Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: rosejdg
Reviews.Content: ROOM 807 was large clean and very comfy king size bed, great location , nice modern room with all the amenities ,only drawback: hair dryer was broke, construction being done in lobby (no bar or restaurant in hotel ,odd for Boston) the front desk employees were VERY snobby so I may not be back even though the rooms were great, I only live 20 min away but went as an overnite with a large group.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming”
Reviews.Author: Koln K
Reviews.Content: I really love this place, which has some neat features like exposed brick walls. This is not the largest hotel room you'll ever stay in, but the location is awesome. My room looked out over the aquarium and it was so fun to get out and walk and be right in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: babydo1l16
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have recently went to Boston. We stayed at Harborside Inn. For the price it was a perfect price and in a convenient location. Its right near Quincy Market. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lazier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to get away for a weekend trip for our wedding anniversary. We had been to Boston before at large hotels and wanted to stay in a smaller boutique hotel in the City of Boston. The hotel is located in a very convenient area, close to highway access to get around the city and in the opposite direction many restaurants and shopping facilities within walking distance. Theater district, Boston Garden, and malls are also a short distance away. If you enjoy pubs like we do, the "Black Rose" is across the street and is very nice. Many of the rooms in the hotel are all built out from an old building and don't have any exterior views but windows look into an atrium. The rooms were a nice size, nice clean bathrooms and beds were comfy. A nice touch was the sterio system wich music in the bathroom as well. Nice flat screen TV was nice too. Again, clean, no bed bugs ! The 2 elevators worked well and were fast. Coffee was available in the lobby all day ! No bell hop so carry your own luggage, but thats ok with me. Overall we thought it was a good hotel and would stay again. The only negative with Boston overall is Parking. It cost us over $100 to park the car for 2 nights ! Parking on the street is almost impossible with a 2 hour limit and parking cops all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding. Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: jazzysailor
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before our flight home after a trip to the Cape for our annual President's Day Weekend Game Feast (the 40th). Excellent location. Very helpful staff. No restaurant on site, but the list in the hotel info binder included walking directions/distance to a good variety. We stayed in an "atrium room" and found it very well appointed in a modern, industrial style. No street window, so very quiet and good for sleeping. Excellent mattress and pillows. Reasonably easy (by Boston standards) to get to and then get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy4665
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with friends and was very happy! I had a room to myself. It was very spacious, clean, well decorated.. fantastic (and I am a demanding traveler). Kingsize bed, TV, DVD player, nice bathroom, huge mirror, good isolation. No view but I mean you're in Boston, you do not stay in your room! They do not serve breakfast but we went to the Marriott every morning (a 5 min walk from the hotel). There were 4 computers in the lobby to use freely. Really beautiful lobby btw. Very cosy. Hotel is close to everything! Just loved it, would stay there again and would def recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Abatrel
Reviews.Content: Located in a nice area of town very close to the waterfront and freedom trail. Rooms are quite spacious and well fitted out. Staff welcoming. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - great value”
Reviews.Author: PanicfanOhio
Reviews.Content: A teriffic little hotel centrally located. Stayed here for 4 nights (bought 3 got 1 free) in January. Was upgraded to a city view and didn't regret it. It was a very quiet, clean room and staff was extremely helpful. Will be coming back to Boston often and will always stay here if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience!!”
Reviews.Author: katy22
Reviews.Content: We popped into the city for one night, without hailing a cab, we shopped, had dinner, drinks and a fabulous hotel room!! The location is the best! Rooms were super comfy, staff accommodating....we will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure for all reasons”
Reviews.Author: JohnEustace1
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in Boston for over 30 years in a great variety of lodgings, from really expensive to a night in the lounge at Logan Hilton after they lost my reservation! So I took a chance on this place, principally on location, next door to the T. I thought it was outstanding from the moment of check in to my 5.00 am departure the next day. Room exceptionally clean, instant wi-fi, etc. Well worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- but get an inside room!”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastFoodie
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed boutique hotel in a great location only steps from the North End and Quincy Market. Unfortunately, the street noise from nearby bars (up to and after closing at 2:00 a.m.) is intolerable, so if you stay, heed the warnings to get an inside room. We didn't and really suffered for it. We stayed only one night, but left Boston exhausted, not a fun way to start the work week. The staff at the front desk is OK. Your iPhone apps may be more knowledgeable and helpful for getting information about restaurants, etc. The rooms are spotless and well-appointed, not large, great for a couple. Parking arrangement at 75 State Street is a big bonus. All-in-all, a good value, but be sure to ask for a quiet room location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boston Getaway”
Reviews.Author: emmakos
Reviews.Content: We went to Boston for my 30th birthday and found this hotel online. I was nervous because some of the reviews stated there was rude staff and it was noisy. We found the exact opposite! The staff were very friendly and helpful the entire weekend. We stayed in a City View room and it was quiet for a city like Boston. We were able to walk to everything we wnated to do and the Market is directly across the street. I would most definitely stay here again and recommend it to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Collegegirl1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a night in Boston, but first had to decide where to stay. We have stayed at the Harborsides sister hotel Charlesmark in the past, and loved it (located in the Copley area). Charlesmark is a great location for shopping and dining, but after all the shopping we done for the holidays..this trip was for relaxation. We chose the Harborside Inn, which is steps away from Faneuil Hall. The hotel was perfect, the room was large, the staff friendly. We enjoyed a dinner at Al Dante in the North End (a ten minute walk from the hotel), and ended the evening with at the Black Rose (minutes from the hotel). We had a wonderful stay in Boston (and the Harborside Inn)...and will be sure to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel1308
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel- you really cannot beat the location. So close to Quincy market, we went there every day for lunch, yum! Stayed here while visiting for a long weekend and would definitely return- clean rooms with surround sound :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: laura r
Reviews.Content: we decided to have a girls night out bewteen Christmas and New Years, we had stayed at The Harborside for my mom's 80th birthday a few years ago and loved it. The rooms are large and comfy for having a glass of wine and we got Christopher Columbus Park all lit up as a back drop! 5 minutes to The Northend for a yummy dinner, and another 5 minutes for a night cap and some live Irish music...staff was great, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: iko105
Reviews.Content: great location! great building! great staff (most of them!). great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit - Great place.”
Reviews.Author: evajulez
Reviews.Content: Location is 2 stops on T subway from Airport . Wheel luggage across the street from station to HOTEL doorstep, Rooms are clean & updated. Beds are comfy. Staff is nice & respectful but not friendly ( no smiles). There are no tours to Plimouth or Cape in the WInter months,. Disappointed. Walking distance to Boston Commons & Frog pond ice skating rink.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business & tourism”
Reviews.Author: FenwayBoston
Reviews.Content: Very well located. Staff is helpful. Rooms are clean and modern. Good value for the money. Free wifi. Right above the Subway. 24 Convenience store at the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: KTRH
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights on holiday during September. Location was excellent, right next to Aquarium T station and easily walkable to main sights. Room had lovely nautical theme and was clean and roomy - only downside was no natural light but we had chosen an atrium room so no real complaints. Tea and coffee station in foyer downstairs was nice to have. Staff were friendly and helpful with dining recommendations. Free wi fi in our room was fast and reliable. Would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Firemedic3674
Reviews.Content: Great time. Clean hotel. Very friendly staff. Subway access right outside the door which goes everywhere. Will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Both Good and not so Good...you be the judge”
Reviews.Author: BBQseeker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Harborside Inn on December 3rd 2011. The hotel is not much to look at aesthetically from the outside, but once inside I was pleasantly surprised by the architectural converted warehouse. The interior is cross between the rustic look of old red brick, post and beam look with a twist of updated hip contemporary design. The rooms are of the same design scheme and has a cool look. The shower is large enough to move around and has nice amenities. The bathroom itself is a bit on the tight side for room but you are only sleeping there. Now down to brass tacks. Good morning coffee. Bad front desk woman (20-25 years of age) working days (no personality, no smile, bad representation for company, put her on the midnight shift or working in the basement) Good afternoon team! Nice and helpful. Hint. Stay in a room not facing an outside street or you will be sorry! (Street Noise comes through the window 7 floors up!) The sounds of drunks yelling, cops barking at the drunks to get off the roadway over the PA like there in the room with you! Again, stay in a room within the center of the hotel and you should be fine. Great location! 200 feet from Qunicy Market!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel for a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Benefactum
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in Boston for a weekend stay. My girlfriend wanted to stay overnight in the city for her birthday. I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel that was centrally located. We found it in this hotel. We had a Queen size city view room. Rooms are located around the perimeter of the building. They either look out onto the city or into a central atruim that runs top to bottom in the middle of the building. Unfortunately I think people can look in unless you close the blinds. Our city view room was quite nice. Parking is off site and affordable, I think it was $24 a day. The foyer does look like it's getting worn out and could be refurbished. The building has interesting features with an air of elagance. The central atruim has some inaccesable ledges on the walls. Over time people have thrown stuff onto them. They should be cleaned off. We had a great time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value on a room in a Boston hotel with an elagant feel. My girlfriend was quite pleased with the whole weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden but awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Synazaur
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel a half dozen times or so when we go to Boston. We frequently travel to Boston to watch hockey games and ran across this place and fell in love. It's walking distance from the aquarium and Quincy market, with plenty of great places to get food in the area. Also on the weekend there's a public market just a few blocks away and also about a miles walk from the North End. All in all, especially for the price, you cannot beat this hotel. The parking is the only issue as you have to walk 2 blocks to get to the garage but it's well worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable rooms at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: ak33
Reviews.Content: We paid about $115 for our room and that seems like a great deal for the location and comfort of the rooms. The furniture was high quality, the room was very quiet, clean and comfortable. It had cool decorations and an exposed brick wall. The only big downfall was that the window shades don't block much light, so the room was pretty well lit when the sun came up.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: himself77
Reviews.Content: Room was nice. Location was great. Staff was awful. At check-in I didn't even get a hello. When I asked where the parking garage was I was told to read the sheet. When I asked what time they lock the lobby door I was told they don't, then told they obviously do. At 2 am. Basically, if you want good location at decent price, stay here. If you want to be treated like a guest, stay somewhere else. And so you know, parking garage is past the hotel at 75 state street for 28 a day rather than the one directly across the street for 35 a day. No hotel parking. And atrium view out your window is the window of the room next to you. I kept my shade down the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Walking to Parking”
Reviews.Author: NunChuckCheese
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a block away from Quincy market. Although the building is old, management seems to put effort to modernized the interior elements. The lighting reflects contemporary interior styling. Starbucks, 7-eleven, and some bars are located walking distance. Bedding is nice and comfy. Restroom is nice and modern. During my stay, I encountered three flaws: parking, structure, and staff. The hotel does not have a parking area. Instead, they suggest usage of 75th State St parking, which is around 2 blocks away. If you are traveling in the winter, arriving late, or traveling for business or vacation, I suggest you to find other hotel as well because of this reason. Don't expect to park your car on the street. Within 3-4 blocks radius, all streets are tow away zone from 2 am to 7 am. No in and out privilege. Once you are out, if you are going back in, you'll have to pay the new rate. Unless you go to the hotel with airport shuttle, parking is disaster. Structure is old. You can hear your neighbor talking or walking. If you are talking inside the room, then the people outside your room can hear your conversation. You can hear squeaky noise from the floor when you walk by. I guess management did not considered the old flooring when they renovate the hotel. Front desk staff seemed arrogant and indifferent. If you park your car by the 75th parking, make sure to have the ticket stamped. The ticket should have Harborside Inn stamped on it. Check before you leave the front desk. They could care less about the parking situation. The hotel is using regular metal key, instead of magnetic key. I personally like magnetic key better, so the key is annoying for me. I hanged the Do Not Disturb sign. When I returned at night, the housekeeping hanged a bag filled with fresh towels. That was pretty nice. I stayed at this hotel during my business trip. In summary: Pro: 1. Close to Quincy market 2. Contemporary interior design 3. Close by mini-market and coffee shops 4. Comfy bed Cons: 1. Noise festival 2. Parking is disaster 3. Front desk staff indifferent and arrogant 4. Regular key, instead of magnetic 5. Old looking furniture In general, don't stay at this hotel. With the same rate, you can get similar hotel with better condition.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ANTfromJerz
Reviews.Content: Slept here for 1 night on september 10. 1/4 of a block from Faneil hall. Small rooms in a uniquely renevated wharehouse with an idoor atrium view. Large bathroom, nicely decorated room and free coffee in the lobby. Front desk staff were very helpful in giving directions and food options. Paid $129 for a friday night stay booked through expedia. Also, the hotel is a block from the harbor and a block and a half from the site of the boston massacre. Also was at the westin harborview for the weekend and preferred the harborside inn. Better location, cheaper rooms, and more comfortable feeling. There is a parking deck around the corner. Validate at check inn to receive a discount

Reviews.Title: “Hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: golfersc
Reviews.Content: We were booking a reservation on rather short notice on a holiday weekend so finding a place that was reasonably priced and near the historic area was a challenge, but the Harborside met all our expectations and more. The price was perfect, the rooms were good sized, well appointed and very clean. Best of all it was literally steps to Faneuil Hall, the North End, Freedom Trail, great dining and a T stop to get back to the airport. Would highly recommend a stay here if you want to be in the thick of things but still have some quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cute well priced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chikletqt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 1 block from Fanuiel Hall and Quincy Market and 1 block from the harbor. So, it is in the touristy area of Boston. The room was unique- exposed brick, industrial lighting, large TV with receiver. There is also a fridge and safe. The great part about the brick is that you don't hear people in the room next to you! There is also a lot of water pressure in the shower- typically something I never find when traveling. You can hear some of the street noise on the weekend, but nothing ear plugs won't resolve (always travel with those!) I thought the price was great considering the area was pretty expensive for November. It is close to several bars- we didn't really find any good restaurants in the area, except when we walked to North End. It was a safe walk. It is also right next to the T.

Reviews.Title: “Harborside Inn - We Love It!”
Reviews.Author: DonNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Harborside Inn in Boston years ago, and are happy to report that it is still a terrific place to stay when visiting Boston. Hotels are expensive in Boston, so it's going to come down to location. Harborside Inn is right in the middle of the city ...close to explore many 'tourist' sites on foot (the Harbor, the aquarium, Boston Common, and of course, Mike's Pastry shop!) The actual hotel is clean and the rooms are very nice. Comfy bed and pillows. The underground station is right outside the door if you are venturing to other areas. Yes, it is true other than some java in the lobby, there is not a breakfast included. But, you can get coffee and breakfast at 7/11; Starbucks, right outside the door. As for the hotel, it is like a boutique hotel, interesting architecture and this time we had a room with a city view which was quite nice. We will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, no-frills hotel in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: April T
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend stay at the Harborside Inn... what a great hotel! Having never been to Boston we were unsure where to stay. This place had good reviews and a great price so figured we'd take a chance. Was definitely a great decision! Pros: location, location, location! Parked the car at check-in and didn't have to move it until check-out. We were able to walk nearly everywhere and for places just outside of walking distance the hotel is about 2 blocks from the State Street T. There are great places to eat just steps from the hotel as well. The front desk was very helpful through our whole stay, which was also pleasing. There are about 4 or 5 computers in the lobby that hotel guests have access too if you need to be near the internet during your stay. The hotel decor is very cute! Loved the exposed brick both in the rooms and in the hallways. Bathrooms were up to date and very nice! We also stayed at another well-known hotel chain during this trip and would have to say the harborside inn wins! Cons: the hotel does offer hot coffee and tea in the lobby but other than that there's not much else being offered outside of a bed to sleep in and free internet. But like I said before there's two coffee shops and a 7 eleven just steps away so it's not that big of an inconvenience. Because of the hotels central location it did get loud on friday night as we had a city view room. We were able to hear people leaving the bars in the middle of the night. Will most likely get an atrium room next time to have a little less noise. The only other complaint is parking - it's expensive even with the hotel validation!! And although we can't fully blame the hotel for this one, it would have been nice to know that we had to pay for a full extra day if not out by a certain time! Guess we should have read the signs in the parking deck more closely. Overall it was a great experience and will definitely be staying here on our next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Tsplash
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. It was very clean and the staff was wonderful. I loved the rooms and they were quiet! No hearing your neighbor or people in the halls. The location was perfect, right next to train stop, trolley tours and aquarium. Acrossd the street was Quincy market to shop. I will come back here again every time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jonhobbs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harborside inn on the first 2 nights of our honeymoon this year. The location is fantastic, bang in the middle of Downtown near the water and the hotel is lovely, modern (small-ish) room with great bathroom and good TV/sound system. The only complaint would be that it has no restaurant or room service so you have to go out to eat. Luckily there's a 24 hour shop next door and plenty of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable non-chain hotel close to T stop and Freedom Trail”
Reviews.Author: TomPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting to attend at the Marriott Long Wharf Hotel and saw that the Harborside Inn had a higher TripAdvisor rating, cost less, and was only about a block from the Marriott. So I decided to give this non-chain hotel a try. I was not disappointed. The hotel is conveniently located about 20 yards from the State St. exit of the Aquarium T stop, and is within walking distance to the Financial District and the Freedom Trail. The lobby was clean and modern. There were several computers there that guests could use. Free wi-fi was also present in the rooms. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Unlike most hotels, room locks are opened with a key, not a programmed card. I don't know if this makes a difference, but it seemed to me that key-operated locks would be less secure (prior guests could make a copy of the key and I doubt the hotel changes locks after each guest). I chose an atrium view room, because of the lower cost. If you like lots of sunshine, you should know that the atrium rooms tend to be on the darker side, but this was not an issue for me. My room had a comfortable king bed with LOTS of pillows, big flat-screen TV, stereo equipment, HUGE mirror, spacious and cool, gray-tiled shower stall, small refrigerator (great for leftovers and beverages), The AC worked well, but it cycled on and off frequently until I realized that I could change the fan speed to LOW. It was very quiet in my room and throughout the whole hotel during my entire stay. If you have active kids, please keep them away from the wall overlooking the atrium as you exit the elevator on the upper floors. The wall was about belly-high and it looked scary looking down from the 8th floor. The hotel had poles on top of the wall and it looked like they were going to install steel cables through those poles to prevent any accidents. But there were no cables during my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sheenakrx
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an amazing location, close to the T, the bay, and food - this is an awesome place to stay. Minimal hotel amenities but Quincy Market is across the street for great food. Old Town Trolley Tours next door were very helpful in planning our trip - we did 2 days of trolley tours (you can get on & off at your leisure) and then a Salem tour the third day. Loved all of it! Northend is in walking distance to great Italian food & Mike's Pastry (amazing). The staff at the hotel were not friendly and did not go above & beyond so keep that in mind if that's what makes you happy. The location made up for it :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Nicki M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient to Boston's financial district if traveling on business. It is also within walking distance to most sights along the Freedom Trail and some rooms provide a view of the harbor. The staff here are very friendly and open to providing recommendations. They went out of their way to help me with a return flight confirmation on the last day of my visit. You will not find certain amenities such as pool or fitness center as with many chain hotels, but the rooms are quaint and the location is good. Our room had one wall of exposed brick and the decor was clean and sleek. There's a convenient store right next door, access to the subway within feed of the entrance, and across the street is Legal Seafood, a great place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but way too Noisey”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stood here for halloween weekend. While we enjoyed the room and facilities we had a terrible sleep. There is a bar directly next to it which sent noise throughout our room until past 2 am making it impossible to sleep. Wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “modern, comfortable rooms in good location”
Reviews.Author: ohe333
Reviews.Content: modern, comfortable - but don't book Atrium view-rooms - there is no real light, just windows to the inside of the hotel (gets dark in the rooms), but beside of this, the room and the service was very good - the location of the hotel is really good - subway is about 1min away (just outside the hotel is an entry to the subway), Quincy Market 3min and the Aquarium also about 4min walk

Reviews.Title: “Not your average inn... I give it at least 3-1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: PhTravelling_Guy
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised. Truth be told, I tend to look at the major brands first when hotel shopping. I was drawn to the Harborside Inn because the name brand hotels were pricing their most basic rooms at over USD350 per night, while Harborside was offering rooms at the USD250-300 range. That Harborside places relatively high in Tripadvisor helped seal the deal. (Why Boston's hotel rates were as high as they were during the time of my short visit, I do not know.) Stayed at a Queen room on the 8th floor facing State Street for 3 nights. At around 230 square feet, I expected the room to be and feel small. I was wrong, it actually felt quite spacious. I liked the room's nautical motif as well with the exposed brick and lighting fixtures adding to the room's overall character. The in-room basics were more or less present (mini fridge, LCD TV, WiFi, desk, personal safe). The room even had a DVD player. Overall, the room looked and felt new and well maintained. The bed was queen sized, fine if you're traveling alone, as I was. The mattress and pillows were just right. The property being an inn rather than a hotel, the room had no pens or writing paper, mini-bar, laundry service, or slippers. The guest services directory was a cheap looking binder with the information printed on basic bond paper. But those don't really matter. The only thing I seriously missed was the complimentary bottled water, a standard amenity in many 5-star hotels. (It helped that the convenience store next door was offering a Buy 1 Get 1 free promotion on 750 ml sized Poland Spring bottled water.) Also, the WiFi signal in my room was pretty weak and the speed was slow. I got a better signal and speed at the lobby. The bathroom was pretty nice. While it was not large by any means, it was nicely designed, compact and functional. No tub. Just a shower. I should mention that the shower area was large for such a compact bathroom. The same was true of the counter space. (They certainly made efficient use of the available space.) I liked the hand held shower and the strong water pressure. The towels were nice, large and soft. The toiletries (shampoo, bar soap, conditioner, shower gel), however, were your no-brand type made in faraway China (relative to Boston). (Good thing I brought my own.) Plastic cups but made of sturdy rather than thin plastic. The room key was a real key not the electronic credit card sized plastic keys you get in most hotels nowadays. Not a criticism. I just thought, as other reviewers have done, that I'd mention it. Room lighting was weak to adequate. I had read other reviews complaining about street noise seeping in for those rooms that face State Street. I can indeed confirm that street noise does seep in. Thankfully, I was in Boston mid-week, so State was relatively quiet at night for the whole duration of my stay. Staff were professional. I checked in early (around 11 am) and was immediately given a room. No waiting. I asked for a late check-out. While I was told that they were booked full for the night, I was nevertheless allowed an extra 30 minutes from the 12 pm check-out time. As for location, as it's name implies, Harborside is close to the harbor. Quincy Market and Faenuil Hall are a short walk, away as are some of the other major tourist sites. It helps that Boston's downtown is actually quite compact. Overall, Harborside was definitely better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: westcountrybasil
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Clean, goodsize modern room and bathroom. Helpful staff, coffee etc available 24hrs a day but no restaurant on site but only 5 mins away from numerous cafes and restaurants as well as the foodcourt in Quincy. Computers and printer available in addition to free Wifi. Expensive but so are all of Bostons hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the heart of the action!”
Reviews.Author: brinalulu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very quaint. Our room was on the very top floor -- it had an amazing street view and the room was beautiful - way beyond my expectations. It was very spacious and had exposed brick - so lovely. Bathroom has no tub but is modern & is small - if you have been to the Charlesmark hotel in the Back Bay they are very similar hotels as they are owned by the same people. At night even though we were on the top floor it was a bit noisy outside -- but we did keep windows open so I am not sure what it would have sounded like if they were closed. All and all the stay was great - and worth the money. I read other reviews about bed bugs but that was not our experience at all - the room felt very clean. The hotel is located nicely by Fanuiel Hall and a short walk to the North End, Aquarium and waterfront. Would stay again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No Bed Bugs in my room on Oct 22-25, 2011”
Reviews.Author: terilindberg
Reviews.Content: We just flew home to Chicago after a few days in Boston. We stayed at the Harborside and had a wonderful visit. The hotel is in the middle of EVERYTHING! Trolleys, harbor, and Quincy Market is one half block away. The North End is within walking distance. The location of this hotel CAN NOT be beat! This hotel is clean and wonderful, and guess what...I flew home without ONE SINGLE bed bug bite. Dont beleive all you read on this site, this hotel is WONDERFUL and highly recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Harborside Boston Convenience”
Reviews.Author: CCCSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for everything in Boston - the T, the waterfront, Quincy Market and shopping too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelkansan
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Harborside Inn. The location is excellent, one block to Quincy Market, close to North End, Aquarium, and Harbor Walk. The Aquarium T stop is out the front door. The room was very nice and our street view room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & modern, great location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Starison
Reviews.Content: taking the MBTA from the airport is a bit complex with 4 different segments. It is do-able, but with suitcases, we chose a taxi for the ride back to the airport. Modern, clean, convenient, expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: JG5554
Reviews.Content: This is a great stay for someone visiting for a day or two. The hotel is very modern and clean. Our rooms were decent in size and came with a great bathroom. Staff was friendly and the location was nice. It was right near the harbor and by a few T stops so it made for a good visit. One downside was that this hotel is located next to a few bars, so when we came back from visiting the city, there were alot of loud, drunk college kids milling around outside. Could not hear them once inside the hotel though. Great price too! Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and central but noisy with poor front of house service”
Reviews.Author: roos1ter
Reviews.Content: Positives first. Room was well sized and close to central Boston. Negatives: do not accept the "upgrade" to a harbour view, as the noise from outside is intrusive - stick with an atrium view as it is bound to be quieter. I felt like a real sucker. Also the front of house staff could clearly not care less - just wanted your money. Almost rude, if they had spent any time with us at all. We watched them deal with a woman in a wheelchair whose taxi had failed to arrive and their attitude was weak - they must be on minimum wage. So avoid, unless you have a short visit

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: BethanieKay
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a one night stay as it was located only 3 blocks from Roweâ€™s Wharf, where I had a business meeting. The hotel is in the financial district of downtown Boston, but itâ€™s also nearby to many of the popular tourist attractions such as the New England Aquarium, Quincy Marketplace, Faneuil Hall, and more. It would be simple to walk all over the area for sightseeing, but if you donâ€™t want to walk, there are numerous sightseeing trolley tours and harbor cruises within 1 block of the hotel if you prefer. The hotel itself is somewhat small (I believe it only had 8 floors); it definitely felt more like a boutique hotel, and what it lacked in size, it made up for in charm. The common areas of the hotel, as well as the room I stayed in, had a â€˜historical Bostonâ€™ feel. The red brick walls were exposed in many places, there were creaky wooden floors in some places, and there was a nautical theme throughout that I found rather charming. The lobby had a big comfortable common area for socializing or waiting, an area with 4 complimentary internet computer stations, and a table set up with complimentary coffee/tea. Check-in was easy and efficient, and the guys behind the desk were eager to provide sightseeing maps and recommendations for lunch. I had a room on the 7th floor, with windows looking out over busy State Street (which the entrance of the hotel is on). Looking out my windows, I could see some of Quincy Marketplace to the left, and the Boston harbor to the right â€“ it was quite lovely. The room had a comfortable queen size bed with 4 cushy pillows and soft linens, a small loveseat, a small table with 2 chairs, a closet with iron/ironing board, a huge mirror on one wall, a huge entertainment center with a very big flat screen TV, speakers, a DVD player, a safe, and a small fridge. The nautical theme was carried out inside the room, as well, with a large painting of a sailboat and harbor above the bed, and a really cool lamp hanging over the table that looked like it was plucked off of a tall-masted ship. The bathroom was modern and bright, with a nice array of amenities (shampoo, lotion, mouthwash), soft towels and a hairdryer. Overall, a spacious and comfortable room. After first getting settled into the room, I was overjoyed at how charming it was, what a good location it was in, and the fact that it had complimentary wireless internet (bonus!). However, my enthusiasm faded later in the afternoon when some shortcomings started to surface: - First, the complimentary WiFi in my room stopped working. Iâ€™d been using it for a couple hours, but when I returned from lunch, it wouldnâ€™t work anymore. I called the front desk (they said they were unaware of any problems), and then I called the internet help desk â€“ but after a long phone call and various attempts, the problem was still unresolved. Not having internet access on a business trip is a deal-breaker for me, so this severely crippled my productivity. Using the complimentary internet stations in the lobby wasnâ€™t an option, either, as the documents and programs I needed were on my laptop. - Second, the creaky floors that I originally thought were so charming then became a bit annoying when I realized I could hear the guests in the room above me walking around. Someone on the floor above me was also playing loud music later that night, which I called the front desk to inquire about, and they had already received other complaints and were getting ready to go talk to the guests about â€“ but I realized how thin the walls and floors of this historical building must be. - Third, after my meeting was done at the end of the night and I was winding down in my room (the internet in my room still wasnâ€™t working, and I know it wasnâ€™t my laptop, as it was able to access WiFi perfectly at my business meeting), I realized that charming State Street (which my windows overlooked) was loud. Very loud. For most of the night. Iâ€™m not sure if the noise was from the nearby bars, restaurants, or even Quincy Marketplace, but it was distracting and I was unable to sleep. Had I known that the area was so loud, I wouldâ€™ve asked for a room that was not facing the street. I realize that the noise on the street is not the hotelâ€™s fault, but the windows were only single paned, so the hotel could attempt to remedy this type of a situation by installing dual-pane windows, or even curtains. The two windows in my room only had mini-blinds, which did nothing to help block out the sound, much less the light. I prefer very dark hotel rooms, so with the light and the noise coming in from outside, I had to use an eye-mask and earplugs to sleep. I know not every hotel can completely soundproof and lightproof their rooms, but Iâ€™d sure prefer if every attempt was made to do so. Overall, this hotel is very charming, well-located, and has many great amenities. Iâ€™d just be leery to stay there again due to the internet problems I experienced on this visit â€“ and if I did stay again, Iâ€™d definitely request an interior room that would hopefully be quieter and darker.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: LHMB
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Boston before I was unsure as to what area to stay in. Im very glad I chose this hotel as it was walking distance to all major sightseeing places. We literally walked everywhere! We had an inside/atrium room and although I was worried about not having a proper window this was not a problem at all as the rooms are spacious and bright. It also had a dvd player which was brilliant as after a full day out walking we would come back to the room and put on a DVD to relax. They don't offer breakfast but there is 24 hour tea & coffee in the lobby. There is also free internet in the lobby (computers weren't great but good enough for printing out directions/flight info etc) and free wi-fi. Front staff were very helpful, we left the hotel to travel North for a week and when I called them when I returned to Boston they still let me use their luggage hold for free as we had a 6 hour wait for our train. Quincey Market is over the road which was ideal for breakfast/lunch. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Milania75
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel as a birthday present for me, we didn't plan anything until we started our 5 hour drive there, and it ended up to one of the best trips yet. The hotel staff additionally was able to provide us with bvery good "intel" on what to do given the time of year, and our stay. The hotel is centrally located, walking distance to so many places. The wifi didn't work in the room, but it wasn't a hassle to sit in the central area and upload, download when needed. The rooms were quaint and very clean. We went as a couple but would not hesitate to stay again with our kids. Certainly looking forward to our next trip already!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Ken6370
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at the Harborside in Late August 2011. The hotel is centrally located in the financial district and within walking distance to the harbor attractions. Room were clean, well appointed and very reasonable at $229.00 for a city view room. The staff was very courtious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great price!”
Reviews.Author: karenlyn13
Reviews.Content: We booked the Harborside Inn, Boston, Mass. the day before we arrived. The price was so reasonable (compared to the other available hotels) that I was nervous we would end up in a dump.What a great surpise to find the hotel was clean and comfortable and had the very best location! The hotel is actually an old, renovated warehouse. Exposed brick leftover from the original structure is evident throughout and gives the place a nice, rustic feeling. The rooms are comfortable, with a table, chairs and a small sofa, big-screen tv and a modern bath, with a stall shower (no tub). Staff could care less whether or not you are there, but they do have coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7 and computers with free internet. I cannot say enough about the location - Metro stop is right outside the door. The hotel is about 4 blocks from Quincy Market and Fanneuli Hall and across the main street and a short 2 block walk to the harbor! One night we even walked the short distance (about 10 city blocks - to the North End for a great Italian dinner. The Main Stop for the city trolleys was right on the corner, a gorgeous parking garage (which the hotels recommends) was about 5 blocks away. ($28.80 per night with validation from the hotel). We loved this hotel and will definitely stay here again when in Boston! The price of $229. per night was a bargain compared to most others that started at $289. and did not have this fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: steveanneso
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay, location great, wifi didn't work in our room.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rosellinarossa
Reviews.Content: the hotel is perfectly located, very close to quincy market and the harbor. the metro is right outside the hotel. it's a bit outdated, the lobby is old fashion, the lobby restroom not very clean nor nice. but anyway it's close to the main attraction, perfect to eat out (even if the prices are higher than other zones). the room has no fridge, nor coffee maker, but there is the safety box, free wifi, big lcd tv. gymn (not used). there is a very good thing: in the room you could find a Boston guide (the top ten or something like this) and you can use it. overall the hotel is nice, good location, very clean, the price is high, but I think it's the average boston price for centrally located hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tippet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four nights the week of September 5, 2011. The room was clean and spacious and faced the atrium. As most of the reviews have stated it is the location and price that sets this hotel apart from others. We were able to walk most anyplace we wanted to go to include all of the Freedom Trail. The MBTA subway stop is right out the front door of the hotel.(Aquarium) We bought a 7 day Link pass for the subway for $15 ea and rode the "T" all over Boston and out to Quincy,MA to see John Adams birthplace and home. We were also able to walk easily to the harbor and catch the ferry out to Salem,MA and back. The hotel is VERY easy to get to from Logan Airport. After picking up your luggage just catch the free shuttle bus to the Blue Line subway stop. Purchase your subway ticket from the kiosk and ride just two stops to Aquarium.Then ride the elevator up to the street and turn left and you are right in front of the hotel. This hotel only has coffee available in the lobby but there are lots of places to walk to close by for breakfast. Computers are also available in the lobby for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “No outside window, but price was right.”
Reviews.Author: cdenofa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small boutique hotel right in the center of things near Fanueil Hall/Quincy Market. The price when i stayed was reasonable. The rooms are nice and big and updated with wood floors and a comfortable bed. The only problem was no window to the outside. The window looks into an indoor atrium. There is no restaurant on the premises, but you are within a block of a lot of restaurants and food and stores. Great location for the price. You can fly into Logan and take the subway right to this stop and walk right into the hotel. So you wouldn't need to rent a car if you stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for city weekend”
Reviews.Author: eirann3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harborside Inn for a long weekend in June. It is located a short walk from the harbor and Quincy Market. The building is a restored warehouse. The rooms are very spacious especially for a big city hotel in the medium price range. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There isn't a restuarant on site, but many choices in walking distance. We really enjoyed our stay and hope to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced for Boston, not bad for business”
Reviews.Author: PDXtraveler281
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days in late August for business. The hotel is on kind of a seedy street, but I did not feel unsafe. It is near the harbor, and Faneuil Hall. Only 2 stops toward the aquarium from the airport. We did not need a car- and are glad we did not have one. It is close to the historic sights. Room was updated, modern, and convenient. Staff was helpful. Because we were here for business and thought we needed extra space, we reserved a larger room. It was so dark and had a large blank wall on one side, that we asked to switch for the remainder of the stay to a smaller room that had a city view. I'm glad we did. Set up for working was good and it included a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JohnFreedem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was 100% perfect. First off, I always judge a hotel by the quality of its shower. This shower was awesome. It was spacious, the water was as hot as you needed it to be, and the pressure was great. The hotel is right across the street from Quincy Market. If you are a shopper, it does not get any better. There is a nice park across Atlantic street going the other direction and all of your dining is there. There are bars everywhere. We counted 7 bars on a block with 8 buildings. The are also several theaters in the area. You don't need a car at all. They are right off of the train line if you are coming from the airport. Everything else is in walking distance or a short cab ride away. If you stay here, be sure to check out Neptunes Oyster bar and Mother Annas (italian food). Beyond that, the hotel itself was awesome. The designers made all of the right decisions. It is a boutique hotel at a reasonable price. I'm hard to please but I felt this hotel was exceptional. I look forward to returning

Reviews.Title: “Precious Gem”
Reviews.Author: JuliaGil
Reviews.Content: A cozy and modern hotel in the heart of Boston. Great installations, close to everything you'll need to discover this beautiful city! Perfect from bussiness, young couples and friends travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great find...we would definetely stay at this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: jmt8479
Reviews.Content: A plain and simple older hotel located in the financial district. Room was clean, bed was comfy and price was right!!! We had a room on the 7th floor with a view. We could hear outside noise even on the 7th floor especially in the morning with trash and construction trucks going back and forth. The plus was that you could walk to just about everything....the harbor front, Fanuel Hall, Aquarium, and restaurants. Parking was located nearby and was validated by the hotel. Coffee available all day in lovely decorated lobby. We would definetely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: Stv50
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Close to Quincy market, lots of restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Bed was so comfortable, my wife didnt want to get up in the morning. Lol. Would have been nice to have a coffee maker in the room, there was 24hr coffee in the lobby, but it was cold and old. Good thing there is a starbucks a block away. The main stop for the trolly tour is steps away and we used it to get a feel for the area. I would recommend that as well. ( old town trolly). There is a lot to see in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and room for the price.”
Reviews.Author: AJ_19eighty
Reviews.Content: Ideal location and spacious comfortable and pleasant room made for a great stay in Boston. Cleaning staff were lovely, reception staff efficient but a little lacking in warmth. Overall one of the best hotels we've stayed in. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and style combined!”
Reviews.Author: Celine_BE
Reviews.Content: We were only in Boston for one night and one day, and for us, this was the perfect hotel. This hotel is so close to the aiport (only 2 metro stops away) and the harbour, Little Italy, ... that it is perfect for a short visit to get around quickly. Location is everything! On top of that, it's really beautiful with modern, spotless rooms (loft style). We really enjoyed our (short) stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: thejaconnection
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for what we were looking for. We came to boston for the day and decided to stay over. After looking around at all the 200-500 per night hotels we thought we were doomed. Then we saw the harborside inn. It took us less than 5 minutes to check-in and the staff was helpful. The room was clean and appeared to be recently remodeled. There was a mini-fridge in the room which is a rare find for moderately priced hotels. As long as you aren't a pretentious jerk you will be happy with the harborside inn.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: wimberleydlc
Reviews.Content: Boston hotels are a bit on the pricey side, so I spent a lot of time weeding thru reviews to make a choice. I was happy with our choice to stay at Harborside Inn. My husband and I stayed for two nights in a Queen City View Room and were very comfortable. The location is great and we plan to return. The only thing I missed was a bathtub, but the shower was nice!

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: clamrj
Reviews.Content: The Harborside Inn is one of those rare finds that combines unique architecture and charm in a terrific location. The hotel, which was built in the 1840s, is on State Street about a block from Long Wharf and the aquarium. The rooms have the original brick walls, tall ceilings and lots of natural light (either from sky lights in the atrium or from the outside windows (depending on whether or not you have an atrium room). Though the rooms are quaint with a bit of an old world nautical motif, the bathrooms are completely modern. There's always hot coffee and tea available in the lobby as well as several computers for internet access. At all times of the day or night you will find plenty of restaurants and bars and Boston's history and site seeing are right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: NCR_Flyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway. We wanted something downtown, near the Fanueil Market area, as we didn't feel like renting a car and dealing with parking. This hotel had a good price and looked nice. We were very pleased. The hotel is 50 feet from the Aquarium T-line station. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms large, clean and modern. Note that our room did not have bathtub- just a shower, so if that is a requirement for you, check with the hotel if they have them. I will note that the lobby furniture probably could use a refresh. It just looks worn. The staff was friendly, but I don't think they have too many folks on duty at any one time. If you're looking for a doorman to get you a cab or a concierge to make dinner reservations for you, I think you need to choose another hotel AND pay the higher rate to get those services. For you self-sufficient travelers looking for a good deal on a good location in Boston, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyPierre_11
Reviews.Content: Great location near Quincy Market and others. Clean and comfortable room recently renovated. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice accommodation”
Reviews.Author: FrancoisX
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little different from most hotels in that there is no food and beverage service aside from coffee in the lobby. There is also no bellman service so you have to take your own bags to the room. You can use the cart in the lobby. The room and the hotel in general were immaculate, rooms looked like they were recently furnished and very nicely done. The rooms were quite comfortable and functional. The hotel is located just steps away from Quincy Market, the aquarium and a subway stop. With so many restaurants nearby you don't have to worry about a taxi to get to dinner. I had only two small issues with this hotel. Their computer platform was not compatible with my company's network so I was unable to use the computers to access my email. The other issue was the fabric sofas in the lobby. The leather sofas are fine but the fabric ones are very dirty and I would not sit on them. This was really inconsistent with the rest of the hotel since everything was very clean but the sofas either need to be replaced or recovered. They really do look bad.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great rate!”
Reviews.Author: SeanOrcutt
Reviews.Content: Reserved this at the last minute, all the reviews were pretty good so we took a chance. When we got there, we were pleasantly suprised at the location and the cleanliness of the hotel. It is centrally located to all of the Boston sights, and the room was very modern and clean. The bathrooms are especially nice and VERY clean. Definately would recommend this to anyone looking for a great hotel in a convenient location! Front desk staff was very accomodating as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, directly in the center, next to the harbour.”
Reviews.Author: soardiac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The hotel is located very close to the Quincy Market which is a centre of many shops and pubs, as the weather was fine, many people were on the street. The hotel seemed to be well booked, we enjoyed the stay even though we only had a room with a window to the inner courtyard with a roof on it. So there was no possibility for fresh air except the modest air conditioning in the room. The shower needed to be decalcified, but everything was clean. Unfortunately we had no minibar, but there are two 24/7 shops near the hotel, plus many pubs. The hotel offers complimentary WiFi, coffee and tea the whole day. Parking is available with a 20% discount at 75 State Street which is about 250 metres from the hotel. A travel guide is in the room to be used during the stay. We enjoyed it to be so close to the centre, financial district, harbour! Compared to the room we got, the price is too high! But maybe that's just because it's Boston?!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the Heart of Boston Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: SurgeonGeneral
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend with friends to check out Boston, even though we only live about an hour away. If you're interested in being a tourist for a day/weekend, this is a fantastic stay. The hotel is modern and reasonably priced. They aren't anything fancy (geared more towards the business traveler), but everything was clean and neat. We didn't spend much time in the room, so I wasn't looking for all of the amenities of a resort. You are walking distance from fantastic bars/pubs (no taxis or driving required!), clubs (if thats your thing), Long Wharf (duck/boat tours), amazing restaurants, and some valuable pieces of American History (Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, the Freedom Trail, Old South Meeting House, City Hall, the Old State House, Cheers, and so much more!) Parking for two days only cost me $28 (which is more than you would pay for 4 hours at the Prudential Center), and was extremely convenient. The next time we venture into Boston, I am looking forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sharintexas01
Reviews.Content: The ambiance of the hotel was really interesting. The rooms were basic but clean and pleasant. We were on the 7th floor so the street noise was not too bad. The staff was pleasant and cooperative. The hotel is very central to many tourist attractions and just steps away from the subway. There are several restaurants close by along with a convenience store. We had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: nFatrin
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was good Love the hotel Especially the location Love the staff i couldnt say they re extremely friendly but they re good enough Love the room An love the lobby it looks cozy The only thing that was bad is the toilet, i couldnt flush the watet Seems like something wrong happened but we re bout to check out so not a big issue

Reviews.Title: “Location was good, that's all”
Reviews.Author: LesleyHall
Reviews.Content: The location was good, but that's about the only good thing going for this hotel. Rooms were very dark, no coffee makers or fridges in the room, icemaker in the basement. This meant getting dressed to get coffee or ice for drinks! Towels were frayed and very old. Front desk staff had no knowledge of area, tours, times of trains, how to get to places - just advised us to ask the Tour Shop two doors down. Definitely not worth it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: srisoldi
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in your Hotel in July. It had that true "Boston feel" to itâ€¦ with interior brick walls, etc. It was conveniently located to many points of interest and most everything I wanted to see, and if not, then you could always take the T (subway). The hotel was very clean and nicely maintained. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Staying at the Harborside Inn truly made my stay very comfortable and convenient. I do plan to come back to Boston for another visit, at some point in time, and would definitely want to stay at your hotel again. Thank you for your wonderful hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: Felice18
Reviews.Content: Walk to everything, very centrally located. Clean rooms, helpful staff. 24 hour coffee in the lobby with REAL half and half! Great breakfast restaurant next door! They could change the window shades in the room to something that keeps the light out better. There is even a stereo system in the roo with built in speakers, and even a speaker in the bathroom!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: Stitchin'goddess
Reviews.Content: Terrific location: "T" station right out front , convenience store right next door and Quincy Market across the street. What more would you need? The lobby had computers to use if needed and the staff was helpful and attentive. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: adamprogers
Reviews.Content: I searched for months trying to find a hotel in a great area in Boston and boy did we find it. The Harborside Inn has Everything you need. The lobby is very spacious, has several computer terminals and printers if you need, wireless in the rooms. The rooms are very spacious, and have a great layout. We were very pleased with the size and comfort of teh room. The closet was huge, and great to store the luggage, as well as a great desk and really nice TV for resting. The room also came equipped with guide books of Boston as well as other local print materials. LOCATION: is 2nd to None. You are 1 minute walk down an alley to the bustling Quincy Market place with a ton of food. Don't forget all the places to eat inside Quincy Market. There are places to get fantastic meals in whatever type of cuisine. The subway stops are either out the front door or one about 5 minute walk away. There is also a 24 hour convenience store two doors down from the hotel. STAFF: very, very helpful. Our first morning there the front desk fella gave us a great review of the subway system and where to find certain things. The fella at night from Alabama gave us some great suggestions of places to eat on the North End and also ways to get there. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at the Harborside Inn and would love to stay there again, and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodation, situation is the key to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Susan_and_Peter
Reviews.Content: Hotel atrium room tired, for example bedding had seen better days, overall effect was very dingy, better lighting please! Hotel staff efficient and courteous but impersonal. Used an Italian pizza place for breakfast (no, we did not have pizza for breakfast, they did bacon, bagels etc. etc.) only 2 doors down but it was not open on a Sunday so had to find somewhere else. Coffee available in reception at all times was useful as there was no coffee maker in the room. The only reason I can see for staying here is the position of the hotel to the attractions of Boston. It was easy walking to just about everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunnah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night to see the sights in Boston . This hotel is located very near Faneuil Hall marketplace and the New England Aquarium. There is a T station right outside the door. Area is great for walking around. Although there was a bit of street construction going on, we stayed in an interior room so there wasn't any street noise. In fact as someone who is usually up bright and early, i was surprised to find out that I had actually "slept in" as it was so quiet in the room. Room was clean and surprisingly spacious. Lobby is nice with computers available for use. Free coffee as well. Staff were friendly and helpful. The only issue that I would note. If I had been traveling on business, I might have found the amenities a bit inconvienant. The lighting in the room was a bit dark (more in line with atmosphere lighting and not conducive to work) and there was no desk chair or desk lamp. Otherwise, for pleasure and vacation trips, I would highly recommend this hotel. It is priced quite a bit lower than the surrounding hotels and certainly gets you into a nice location to be able to enjoy Boston.

Reviews.Title: “WOW- way above expectations!”
Reviews.Author: GayTravelCouple
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels that I have ever stayed at. I cannot think of a single flaw. The rooms were outstanding in every way and the staff was extremely helpful. They went above and beyond in helping us find a tour to go on and they researched a little known cabaret bar across the city and gave us helpful hints on what to tell the taxi drivers so that they would think we were locals and not rip us off. The 24 hour coffee and tea in the lobby was a nice touch too. This hotel has a great location, great value, amazing service, and the rooms, beds, and bathrooms are absolutely spectacular. I will reccommend this hotel to all friends and family travelling to Boston and we will definately be staying there on our next visit. I am thrilled that we found this little gem in the heart of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Borisrocks
Reviews.Content: Smack in the center of town, one block from Quincy Market, one block from the harbor. 24 hours coffee and newspapers in the lobby. Room w/city view was functional , but not luxurious. Beds are excellent. Hotel staff was kind but not going out of their way. However we arrived from the West Coast at 6.00am and were able to check into our room!!! Thanks!!! Room could do with some newer furniture AND A REFRIGERATOR. However we were content.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, nice, location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: soreiml8
Reviews.Content: We discovered on a previous, week-earlier, trip through Boston that we needed to be close to Fanuiel Hall, Quincy Market, and the Freedom Trail -- this hotel was perfect for that. We found our atrium-view room was modernly appointed, with contemporary furnishings. The atrium view is nothing to brag about, however, since it only looks down to the front desk. I can't stress enough how the location is the best part -- we walked all around and really enjoyed ourselves. A couple more details -- the bed was comfy and the linens were really luxurious. The shower had fantastic tile. The lobby of the building reeked of stale cigarette smoke, but the rest of the building did not (I suspect the old couches are to blame and should be thrown out!). We didn't get breakfast or transportation with the purchase of our room, and that's okay with us -- we knew that beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: JAH22Cincinnati
Reviews.Content: The Harborside Inn is a great place to stay. It is very clean, the staff is helpful and the location cannot be better. There are many places to eat within a short walking distance. It is within walking distance of many of the attractions. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Hm”
Reviews.Author: ergoe
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent from a tourist point of view. A very interesting neighbourhood. Close to all kinds of bars, restaurants and shops. Staff at the reception desk were friendly and helpful. The room (309) was spacious and clean, free of odours and, most importantly, noise. However, because of its dingy lighting, it made a most inhospitable impression. I would hate to have to spend a whole day in it. It has all the charm of a cell in a penitentiary. The bathroom was spotless with a great walk-in shower. A couple of firsts: no bible anywhere and no brochures promoting the neighbourhood. And a third first: no note pad and pen. A fourth first for me: A Sherwood thingy combined with a Sony thingamajig, neither one of which I dared to touch for fear of not being able to turn them off. The free internet access was spotty at best. If you want to watch a YouTube video clip in its entirety, you'll probably have to extend your stay by a couple of days. The desk was unlit and too high. Or maybe the chair was too low. Anyway, it was not very comfortable. I would hate to do serious work at it, but then, I guess, if you stay here, work is not the first thing on your mind. Would I stay here, in this room, again? No!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: stmauloni
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location; for a great price. Almost half of the price of the larger chain hotels for a weekend! For travelers on a budget; this hotel is perfect. Loved the complimentary coffee in the lobby, and the helpful front desk staff was great. Cool bathroom; awesome shower. Quiet room. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location-That's about it!”
Reviews.Author: arger1202
Reviews.Content: We selected their largest room with a king-size bed which was fine but there is very little furniture in the room. There was no "view" which we knew-the window overlooks a narrow atrium. There were construction noises (jackhammer) starting at 7am until 4pm-very annoying . The lobby is very small and "old" looking. Guess that's supposed to be charming "old" Boston. The location if you want to spend time at Fanueil Hall and Quincy Market is excellent-less than 2 short blocks away. For the price charged we found virtually no services and would opt for staying at a Marriott or Hilton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: coveredwagon
Reviews.Content: A older building which must have undergone renovation at some time with an odd air shaft from lobby to roof. There are computer stations on the lobby floor. The location is perfect being walkable to the seaport, Quincy and Fanuil hall and scores of tour busses in the immediate area. Plenty of Irish pubs in the walkable area. You can get on and off the tour buses, one stop for the 'duck boats' (about an hour wait time). Visit Cheers and if you can lower your standards for a dat, visit old Fenway park but the guides can be a bit surley. But we are discussing the hotel, fine for the price and location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for a Boston stay”
Reviews.Author: miserablescot
Reviews.Content: After a week of business we chose Harborside for its location and could not have done better for the price. A better quality room than most 4 star hotels. Really helpful staff. No food facilities, but this adds to the fun as there are dozens on the doorstep. T station outside plus water taxis only 100 yards away. I will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “I Know Why the Pillows Are So Soft”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPolo6566
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Harborside Inn on Tuesday, June 7th around midnight after a long cross country flight. The front desk attendant was pleasant but gave no notice of what was to follow. The room itself was very well done, although the stool in the bathroom was not secure, as it was at an odd angle and freely moved around the floor. I found the bed to be very soft, along with four very soft pillows, which I assumed were for resting a head on while sleeping. Shortly after turning out the lights, I realized that the pillows were not soft for sleeping, rather they were soft for another reason. They are best used to bury your head as deeply as you can under a pile of them in an attempt to mitigate as much of the external noise as possible. This includes being able to hear your neighbor on a phone very clearly through the wall, the trash service that comes between midnight and 1 AM on the street below for at least an hour - diesel engines and dumpsters clanging, and finally the construction crews that start dumping things from second story windows into an open 32 foot roll-off from 5AM to 7AM, right below your window. All of this noise sounded so loud, as if my windows were open. When I made a comment to the front desk in the morning, I got a "Yup". Result: If you are a couple, wanting to make a lot of noise and don't want to be heard, the external noise should be sufficient. If you are a single traveler looking for a good night's sleep, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, cool, unique rooms, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: zerb1855
Reviews.Content: The location is great, very close to Fanueil Hall, the financial district, the waterfront, and the North End for some great food. The rooms are very comfortable with nice interiors, comfortable bed, exposed brick, modern bath, large flat-screen tv. I will probably stay here more often when I come to town. The only downside was that the lobby smelled like an old smokers room. But that shouldn't detract anyone from staying here. Very cool, very unique place!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Great Location and Unique! Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: xcatch
Reviews.Content: This unique property has all the feel of a boutique hotel. The rooms, although smaller than what has become the norm, were still plenty spacious with a gorgeous bathroom. The central location was perfect for a traveller who wants to see all areas of Boston and is is located right at a Blue Line T stop, making it easy and inexpensive to get anywhere you would want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it was”
Reviews.Author: flowerlady64
Reviews.Content: As our son was graduating from Boston University we had to be in town last weekend so had to pay the high prices hotels in Boston demand at this time of year. The location was hard to beat as others have said and the king size atrium room was quiet and large but cold and impersonal. There was a huge mirror propped up against the wall which looked like it had fallen off the wall and the room was sparsely furnished like it wasn't finished yet. A sofa would have made it feel more welcoming. The bathroom sink had no plug; is this trendy now? There was no fridge, microwave or coffee maker as we have come to expect in a lot of American hotels. We found this strange as the hotel has no restaurant but there's a well stocked shop at the end of the block which we could have used if only we had had a fridge to put the food in. Free coffee and tea was available from the lobby. Check in was reasonably friendly but the employee on check out needed more customer service training. We felt the porch on the front of the building was a grubby eyesore and needed a good sweep up. We visit Boston several times a year to see family but wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality,location and value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean and updated rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Perfect location to enjoy several parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Denver52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to visit all the sites. The rooms are clean with no frills. I do agree that some of the front staff were not especially friendly but they always answered questions and provided assistance and that's what is really important. We were in one of the atrium rooms and it was very quiet except for a very short time on Saturday night. All in all a nice stay with easy access to the T to get to the airport and other places.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: mamaplanes
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel near everything. The staff were very helpful. No, there's no bellman, but just call from the car and they'll come out and help you with the bags. Parking is around the corner for less than valet parking at the bigger hotels. Free Wifi throughout the hotel and computers in the lobby with a printer. If you want a quiet room ask for one on the top floor with atrium views. I slept like a baby and heard nothing all night. There are plenty of places to get breakfast very close by. If you want room service, there is a brochure in the room for a company that works with at least 100 local restaurants to deliver food to your room for a small delivery fee. The king atrium room was huge. We had a wonderful time and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: brigette_garbin
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to Quincy Market, where we ate at least once a day. Subway stop right at the front door. Room was fine, however no window to the outside, only a window facing the hallway, which was a little claustrophobic. Staff were not that friendly, especially at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kgood4
Reviews.Content: This is a small, clean, no frills hotel in a great location in Boston. If you are a tourist, everything you want to see will be within walking distance. The room was nice and clean, my only complaint is the noise. Since it is in such a popular area, there were a lot of people walking by, being loud late at night and there were loud trash trucks around 5 am but that is what you get when you stay in the popular area. It's just not ideal when you have young children or if you are a light sleeper. I would definitely stay here again, I would just ask for an inside facing room this time. Staff was great, there are no fridge's or microwaves in the room so they kept my son's milk for me and even heated it up. I really appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “A great value and amazing location for any tourist”
Reviews.Author: eliszewski
Reviews.Content: The Harborside is ideally located for access to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, The North End, the Aquarium, and more. I live just down the street in downtown Boston, but I decided to take a little "tourist in my own city" trip. With nearly everything you need within walking distance as well as the Aquarium T stop on the blue line being located right outside the door, you can't ask for a better spot. The hotel was quiet, though the streets outside are lively, especially on weekends in the summer. The hotel has an atrium in the middle, so half the rooms are street-facing and half are atrium-facing. For more quiet go for the atrium, for a view go for the street side. The room was very clean, simple, and a standard size. It was definitley no frills, but had all the essentials. This is seriously the best bang for your buck if you're a tourist in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice plain hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dood1989
Reviews.Content: The Harborside Inn is not a fancy hotel, very plain from the outside and while the room were big they weren't decadent which is fine because I don't like paying through the nose for artwork on the wall and fancy chairs that I'm not going to use because I am out and about seeing the sights of Boston. I was a bit concerned about the location of this hotel (on the map it looked like we were in the Financial District which I thought would be boring) however I found that any hotel that is located on the Freedom Trail has a great location because there are lots of restaurants, shops and historic (and beautiful) sights all along the Trail.
