The hotel staff are really nice and helpful, our toilet was blocked when we arrived, we went downstairs hoping to get it fixed but instead they just upgraded us to their best room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lroden
Reviews.Content: Good points: LOCATION (a few steps from T, a few steps from Fanueil Hall, a few steps from financial district, a short sprint to airport); friendly staff (loaned me their personal umbrella, spent an hour rewiring our TV, gave lots of detailed area directions, all super helpful and responsive); price (decent discount.) Bad points: NO help whatsoever with luggage, had to handle 4 suitcases down narrow halls by ourselves. No room service or restaurant. Charge for internet. No gym/workout center. Worst of all: NO NATURAL LIGHT IN ROOM. You start to get the willies after a while when you are in a totally enclosed cell. Rooms face inner courtyard, had to keep blinds closed for privacy, got no light at all, didn't know if it was day or night, sunny or rainy.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown great location”
Reviews.Author: Goodmood_ch
Reviews.Content: I would recommand this hotel. Perfectly situated (the subway stop "Aquarium" is right in front of the building") this hotel is a good pick. Complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby, vending machine downstairs at a reasonable price. This hotel does not provide breakfast, however the "Au bon pain" shop at a few minutes walk sells croissants and other yummy pastries to start the day. We had an "atrium view" room which was a little bit "depressive" due to the lack of light, I would probably recommand choosing a "outside view" room. Otherwise it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Attention Created the Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: snowshoe00
Reviews.Content: A very helpful evening clerk helped us map out our stay and even provided us with tickets for the T to relax what might have been a hectic morning. We were centrally located, and also had ready access to the T. The room was clean, cozy and well appointed. We'd come back here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place . Great Location”
Reviews.Author: steve1991
Reviews.Content: Right across the street from the waterfront (Long Warf). Spacious, clean rooms with nice bathroom/shower. Friendly and helpful staff. Walking distance to numerous retaurants and the "T" (the boston train/subway). I did not have a car so I don't know about the parking situation . No in hotel retaurant or breakfast but plenty of nearby place available. Hotel serves free coffee/tea in lobby at all time. Free computer terminal/internet access in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: LaxnFH
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here. The location wasconvenient to everything we had planned.The room was spotless, comfortable bedding and beautiful lighting.We get to Boston often ...we usually stay at a large chain hotel closer to our daughter's school...but were never impressed and prices were higher.We will stay here from now on. What a great find!

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFamilyBoston
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. Have stayed here several times for one-night getaways from the kids. Lobby: Clean, comfortable. Several computers with a printer set up for use. Free coffee/tea. Some might call the decor dark and uninviting, a bit industrial. Only staff is typically one person at the desk. They are businesslike and professional but not particularly friendly or welcoming. No lobby rest rooms. No vending machines. No restaurant. Room: Two options- atrium view (which means air shaft) and city view (which is usually a view of nearby tall buildings). Don't go for the view, unless you can pick a specific room. Bare brick walls with intriguing details left over from previous life as a factory or warehouse. Very comfortable beds, plenty of pillows. Roomy, with a table and chairs. Large flat-screen TV with stereo and DVD player. Baths vary in size from cramped to huge. No tub, just shower. Everything is clean and modern. Generally quiet, but sometimes a little street noise from bars below drifts up. No coffee maker in the room. Location: Perfect for walking around downtown. Use Google maps to check it out if you are going to quibble over a few tenths of a mile to get to specific locations. Lots of restaurants nearby. Parking is a hassle, as *anywhere* in downtown boston. Expect to pay 2X for a room elsewhere with "free" parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Relaxation_Finder
Reviews.Content: This is a little gem of a hotel. The rooms where more spacious than I had anticipated - we had 3 suitcases & skis & there was still plenty of room. Great bathroom & large shower cubicle. We stayed in an atrium room & I must admit that I did hear people talking downstairs in the lobby at around 7am - I think they may have been having a business meeting - which did disturb me a bit. Don't let the outside appearance put you off - when we walked out of the metro I was a little taken aback by the semi - permanent (at least I hope it is) attachment on the front of the building - it looks like they have tacked a plastic bus stop on the front which does nothing for the kerb appeal of the hotel Having said that it's in a great quiet location. We'd definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice hotel, bumps in the night tho...”
Reviews.Author: CouplesGetAway
Reviews.Content: All in all this was a great hotel in an excellent location. I was a little skeptical from the pictures, but am happy to say that they don't do the place justice. Our room even had a very sizable tv and surround sound system with full cable. Its somewhere between no-frills and deluxe. Free wi-fi, printing, coffee, tea and newspapers. Great dining recomendations and a very good rate (we stayed here on a special from hotels.com with our third night free). My only solitary, really minor complaint is that our room was next to a housekeeping closet, so every morning we would hear bumps while the staff rolled out the carts and vacuums. It wasn't bad enough to ask for a different room, just a bit annoying. Would highly recommend to friends looking to save.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambiance, good location”
Reviews.Author: nss2232
Reviews.Content: Well-appointed modern rooms. Great value and near some pretty popular bars for friday or saturday night out.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Dianne060
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the North End and Faniel Hall. You can walk to everything easily. The rooms are spacious and very clean. We have stayed there 5 years in a row for the Boston Wine Expo weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and easy access to the Blue Line T.”
Reviews.Author: ams3300
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience. Took Blue line T straight to hotel from airport. Literally right across the street. A couple blocks from Legal Sea Food, Chart House, both great restaurants. Walking to Fanuel Hall and wharf area. We had a city view and it was gorgeous with all the snow in the city. Good service, but I think we had a new person at desk, she was struggling a little, but another employee helped her out. All in all, we would definitely book again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool building and great location”
Reviews.Author: WeichiaS
Reviews.Content: Location is my first consideration. Quincy Market is just ONE block away! The hotel is reconstructed from one or some brick building(s). My partner's major is Architecture so he loved it very very much. Everything looks new in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to all downtown area.”
Reviews.Author: 4tomorrow
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel. It's quiet, clean, wonderfully accommodating staff, and 24 hr coffee/tea in the lobby. All rooms are above the first floor by elevator. In the middle of the Financial District, with the T Line subway steps from the front door. Tour buses across the street, and walking distance to Little Italy northend, Quincy Square and Faneuil Hall, the Aquarium, State Buildings, and the wonderful Brady Pete's Restaurant. The food is OUTSTANDING. It's the place where business people from downtown go to lunch. We couldn't have found a more reasonably priced, convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel on Earth”
Reviews.Author: SeeAmyGo
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my experience in Boston a great one. The staff was very helpful. They allowed us an early check-in, and we even received a complimentary upgrade to a city view room. When you walk out the front door, you are steps away from a T stop. Also, the harbor, Quincy Market, and Faneuil Hall are very close by. Check-out was earlier than our flight departure time, so the staff held our luggage in a locked room while we went sightseeing. No matter how many times we asked them for directions, change, etc, the staff never treated us like we were and inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the greatest”
Reviews.Author: Hhnrs04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov. 19 thru 21. What a great place. Great location. Near everything. Always stayed in the Back Bay area at large hotels. Never again. I found my home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Neat, centrally located, independant hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandS_Monkey
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, centally located 2 mins from quincy market and really close to the metro. Small independant hotel, well furnished rooms with large TV and nice bathrooms, friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Great Staff--”
Reviews.Author: MaineCouple207
Reviews.Content: Had read all the reviews on here, and noted many felt there was excessive noise, so we chose an inside room with window into the atrium....Noise was never a problem, and though we could hear music from the downstairs nightclub while in the lobby, i cant beleive it was an issue for anyone in the hotel....the location is only steps from scores of restaraunts, bars and lounges...there is something for everyone with a 4 or 5 block area. Would stay there again in a heartbeat, and with 2 of my sons living in the are, I am sure I will !!

Reviews.Title: “great location to explore boston”
Reviews.Author: ajjcummins
Reviews.Content: stayed here early november 2010. hotels location is great for boston exploring. its only 2 stops from the airport on the T, right outside aquarium station. hotel itself is well kept, rooms were very clean and up to the standard of group/chain hotels. reasonable size room and ensuite bathroom and huge tv ... location is best quality... only 2 mins walk to fanueil/quincy market, which is a great place for food (eat in or to go) and shopping. loads of pubs and reataurants near too, we ate in legal seafoods one night which was great. weather wasn`t great when we were there so we will return again to see more of boston and would definitely stay at this hotel again... another thing i forgot to mention there is a 24 hour mini market 10 yards from front door

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: inkmahm
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and loved it. We arrived on an early flight and were able to get to our 6th floor city view room hours before normal check in. The room was clean and very comfortable. Lots of storage space, electric outlets, lights. The TV was great! Wifi service in the room worked well and was free. The best part about this hotel is definitely its location. So much is within walking distance! We loved the area the last time we visited Boston and said the next time we would come we would stay where we were spending most of our time. This hotel allowed us to do that. The price was SO much better than nearby hotels, too. I highly recommend Harborside and we will stay here again on future trips to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: rummared78
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location with the subway right infront and walking distance to the marketplace and aquarium. make sure you ask for the top floor due to the loud bar next store to hotel. its very clean. the only thing i didnt like is that there was vomit right next to the outside door that took management two day to clean up!!! i even complained twice about it.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: walkertraveltalker
Reviews.Content: First of all, we arrived in Boston on an early flight, and with only 1 day notice, the hotel staff was able to provide us with an early check-in. This was really great as we left home for a 6a.m. flight and our connector in Toronto was at 8:50...with little sleep it was nice to have someplace to unwind and freshen up before starting our day. The room was very clean and modernly updated, with plenty of storage in the closet and on the shelves provided. One night table had two large drawers for more clothing. The lighting was good, and also had two windows that opened. We were on the 8th floor with a city view of Columbus Park, and the marina...very pretty at this time of year. It was a bit noisy but we were there to experience everything, and were typically not bothered by noise at night. This hotel is in a great location, close to the TD Garden (hockey game), the Harbor, the Aquarium, Legal Seafoods, Quincy Market and other touristy type attractions. This is one of the first hotels that I've stayed in that the bed was actually comfortable and i got a good nights sleep. The bathroom was a little small, but ok because we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room anyhow (also, i think we may have had a Halloween ghost as the bathroom door would close on it's own...lol) We loved this location and when we do return to the area will stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Great location -but noisy neighbours!”
Reviews.Author: HelenM61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, right beside Quincy Market and Long Wharf. Nice, clean rooms, however beware if you're looking for something quiet, there's a very loud and noisy bar right next door to the hotel, we had to put up with ear splitting thumping music (which we could hear on the 4th Floor) on a few nights which didn't stop till 4am. We made repeated calls to reception who said "sorry but we have a lot of complaints about loud music from that bar, we call them about it but they don't do anything". Well you'd want to get them to do something or you're going to loose a lot of business!

Reviews.Title: “I'd certainly stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dalialuna
Reviews.Content: I was worried that this hotel would be in an area that was dead at night, but I was wrong. It's well-situated, with good restaurants nearby and the city's Italian neighborhood a ten-minute walk away. The hotel is also right on the blue line, making it easy to come and go to the airport via the metro system. I found the room spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. If I had one complaint, it is that the fan that cools the room can be a bit loud. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..not a great experience...”
Reviews.Author: harrodsfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. we were really disappointed. We arrived by car. There was no doorman to help with luggage nor valet parking. Nor parking really. We were told that there was a parking garage two short blocks away. It was four long blocks and it was raining too. Our room was tiny and the "view" was of a building. very overpriced. The lobby was seedy with furniture that had seen better days. Very worn. The lobby was also very uninviting. It was two blocks to Quicy Market was its only good feature in our opinion. Very over rated. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a gem; an excellent location walking distance to the harbor, major attractions, and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Susan60761
Reviews.Content: This is a converted facility so every room is different and unconventional. It is clean and the location is unbeatable; much more affordable than nearby "name" hotels. The only complaint we had was service from some of the front desk staff was curt at best. Some were great but a few were really horrible (Robert for one) and not pleasant at all. If the management would resolve this personnel issue, I'd have no problem fully recommending this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Harborside Inn of Boston right in town”
Reviews.Author: jaywalk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less that 20 minutes from the Logan Airport via the subway and the subway stop is practicality right in front of the hotel. The room is clean with a large TV. Bathroom is up to date with a large shower. Free coffee/tea all day long in the lobby. Free use of the internet (4 machines) with printer. Quincy marker is only 2 short blocks away and the aquarium is just down few minutes away. Many resturants near by also a 24 hour convenient store at the corner to buy snacks/drinks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigjer30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three days in mid-August. We had a king size bed Atrium room. The room was a bit small but the bath facilities made up for it. The room did not have a microwave or refrigerator and you had to go the basement on the elevator to find the ice machine. It's great strength is its locatoin. There is a T station right in front of the hotel and the wharf, aquarium, Feneull Hall marketpalce , Freedom Trail, and North End restaurants are all within easy walking distance. We would definitely stay here again, but wish our room had had a refrigerator and microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, not not price”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the harborside hotel. The hotel was a little overpriced but the location and front desk couldn't be better. The housekeeping was a little suspect. If you're looking for a hotel in the middle of the city you could do better but don't write this place off. Go to the north end for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Will stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: mendovacation
Reviews.Content: What a great place! located near everything you want and need to see in Boston. Lovely old charm, wonderful & helpful staff, very comfortable & clean rooms with all the nice amenities! Computers for guest use in the lobby. 24hr coffee/tea in lobby as well. Comfy big chairs and couches to read the morning paper in the lobby. We walked to Fanuiel Hall, super Pubs, restaurants, historic sights, the harbor, took the subway to Harvard, walked to Beacon Hill, Newberry, the Commons. Our favorite area was the North End...only 15 min walk from the Hotel. LOVE the coffees and pastries at Mike's and Modern Pastry too. the BEST ever!! Such a friendly city....this Hotel is not to be missed. You do not need a car or a taxi. You are in the heart of this lovely historic city!!!!! I highly suggest you stay nowhere else! did I mention the hotel rate is cheaper than most? can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “We were very pleased with this hotel and will definately come back”
Reviews.Author: DebGillette
Reviews.Content: I always read the reviews on trip advisor before I go anywhere and since the reviews were pretty favorable we booked this hotel. The location is great - right next to Faneuil Hall Marketplace and close to the harbor. Everything is just a few short blocks away. I thought the service at the front desk was fine and did not encounter any rudeness at all. We got a room with a window rather than an atrium room. I don't think I would like an atrium room as it would be too dark. There wasn't any real view from our window but that was fine. The room was very nice looking inside and the walls were like the inside of brick building which was cool. The bathroom had a very large walk in shower and was fantastic. It was very up-to-date. Everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The lobby has 4-5 computer stations where people can access the internet and wireless internet is free in your room. I would definately stay there the next time I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jfuquay
Reviews.Content: The Harborside Inn isn't much to look at from the outside -- having a subway stop practically at the front door can do that. But they've done a great job inside, and then you come to appreciate having a subway stop at your front door, and it's all good. I thought I wanted to stay in the Back Bay, but being near the wharfs was probably better for what we did -- Freedom Trail, North End, Faneuil Hall, a harbor cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: kbuzz65
Reviews.Content: Was able to get a special offer over Labor Day weekend. The location is superb. Staff was friendly. Room was great. Bed was comfortable. Definitely will be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room at a fair price in a GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: Tychain
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews here for this hotel before making my decision... Don't let the bad ones scare you off! My wife and I travel quite a bit and expect only a few important things from the hotels we stay at: A smile at the front desk, a clean room and a good nights sleep... We got all of those! We chose this area because we were going out on a rock cruise and wouldnt be getting in til late. I wanted to be able to walk back to the hotel so our options were limited to 4 or 5 hotels in the area and I didnt want to pay a fortune for a room we were going to use for 7 or 8 hours. As it turned out, we felt so safe in the area that we went out after the cruise and didnt get in til 2:30! : ) So much to see within such a short walking distance. Bars, restaurants, the waterfront, North End (Mikes Pastry!) and Faneuil Hall! What a difference to this area now that the Big Dig is complete! We had one of the rooms looking into the atrium... no view, so what... thats why you go outdoors. *smile* By the way, my wife loved the huge mirror! The Harborside Inn is just a nice place to stay... we recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ncdjchris
Reviews.Content: My teenaged son and I enjoyed our stay at the Harborside Inn. It is very easy to get to from the airport, as the Aquarium T station is practically right outside the front door. The room we had was not an atrium room. They might be a little louder than the one we had. My son said he heard people on the street from the bar outside. I was too tired, and it did not bother me. Our room was a little small, but attractive, and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly. When we left our do not disturb sign up all day, they left clean towels in a bag on our door. They had computers in the lobby for guests to use, although we did not use them. They have coffee and tea available in the lobby 24 hours a day. I like the location of this hotel, because it is within walking distance of Faneuil Hall and Qunicy Market, the N.E. Aquarium, the North End, and Legal Sea Foods. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovation”
Reviews.Author: rgjk
Reviews.Content: I though the room we had was renovated beautifully, and felt extremely comfortable in it given that the size was small . all this for a great price and location. it is a little no frills but once you get into your room you will be impressed

Reviews.Title: “Quiet oasis in busy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Rough-it
Reviews.Content: It doesn't look like much from the street, but once you're inside, it's a comfortable, well-staffed, quiet hotel. And for anyone arriving from Logan Airport, the hotel couldn't be easier to reach: Get on the Blue Line, go to AQUARIUM, and you'll find the hotel entrance directly across the street from the T-station exit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: wisconsin81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced and has an awesome location. It is only two street crossings away from Boston Harbor. There is a T (subway) entrance directly across the street. Popular places like North End, Freedom Trail, and Quincy Market are close by. Room Details: I booked an interior room with no view for $109/night plus tax (Mid July). This is an excellent rate considering what neighboring hotels charge. I felt safe here, the room was clean, and quiet at night. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel offers FREE internet access in the rooms and four computers in the lobby for guests. The rooms are perfect for one person or adequate for two. WARNING: Make your reservation online. *If you ask for an interior room (the cheapest room available) over the phone sometimes the staff will lie and say it is sold out or not available. This might not be true so visit the hotel's website to be certain. It happened to me so just be careful.

Reviews.Title: “expensive and somewhat unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: intrepidexplorersid
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our first visit to America before we set out to explore. When we arrived we foound drunks out front begging money for the 7-11 and the foyer was a bit of a let down. not that friendly reception staff and expensive. the room was nice but not like those on the website. no coffee making facilities in the room, hot water flasks in reception for you to use. free web access which was good but the hotel was a bit far from the nightlife and the better shopping and historical sights. For this we had to treck across to the Boston Common area which was far better. all in all, too expensive, too far out of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Concierge”
Reviews.Author: solotrip3
Reviews.Content: This place was pretty pricey... and even worse everyone gets a different rate! The stink eye the Concierge gives you when you leave your room really makes you wonder if your stuff is safe! But if you got big bux- and don't mind a little stink eye- it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Updated hotel in great Boston location”
Reviews.Author: mariavhaag
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and updated. Conceirge was helpful and polite. The location was convenient (1 block) from Quoncy Market and the waterfront and many historical sights.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff Attitude - Family Unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: rinvio
Reviews.Content: I was at the Harborside Inn during a large international conference in Boston. Although I was traveling for business, I do not mind checking for good rates, so I got this hotel for about $180x night + taxes. What a disappointment! The rooms had no windows (right no windows, i.e. only a glass with a view on a brick wall). The staff was rude and useless. The last night, I was joined by my wife and daughter, who were visiting relatives in the area. When we asked for a portable crib or something similar, their response was: "we do not accommodate families". I honestly do not know what that means. In brief, my 15 month daughter was not welcomed. Do not fall for the price. With extra $20-30, you can find something much better than this [--] with rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “RIGHT NEAR EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: cnj3511
Reviews.Content: i went on a romantic trip from ny to boston. i can not complain about this hotel. it is sooo conviently located near everything. if u stand in the street infront of the hotel, you can see the boston masacre building so nicely lit up. the freedom trail is just a few blocks away. the trolley is right infront of the hotel, the aquarium and water is a few blocks away. the faneuil hall is literally 1/2 a block away. before going to boston, i did a lot of research because i wanted to make the trip perfect. i read that you should request the higher floors to avoid the noise in the streets from the bar next store. they had no problem helping us out with this. i could not complain because i did visit many bars myself. you can literally see 6 bars from the hotel. the rooms are clean and spacious the only problem i had was there was vomit outside the door which was not cleaned up until late afternoon. i did tell the front desk two times about it. other than that i would recommend this hotel for those who want to experience boston "irish style"!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unfair Pricing, Discourteous Staff”
Reviews.Author: amf11746
Reviews.Content: Although the Harborside Inn is located in a great area...we stayed there with four other couples who were all given better rates than we were given. Our friends had bigger rooms with views of the street and payed less money than we did. We were given a smaller room with a view of a brick wall. When we attempted to trade rooms or get a better rate, the front counter staff was rude and unwilling to at least match the rate our friends were given. We also found a large nail clipping on the floor (gross). The day after we checked out I had called to discuss this with the operations manager and he had no interest in anything I said. We will definitely stay somewhere else next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere unless you don't mind a lecture from front desk.”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain1959
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my cousin as the last leg of our New England trip; including Martha's Vineyard. Upon arrival our reception was okay. Went to the room and it was ghastly. Dark, old bedspread, with a view of the 'atrium'. Well the atrium 'view' consisted of looking at 3 walls within 7 feet of our window! Called the front desk and spoke to Robert. I explained that the quality of the room was poor. Thus began a nightmare. I went down to the reception area. I was repeatedly told "Well that's what you asked for online". Robert went on lecturing me for a few minutes to the point that I requested a refund on my Amex card so that we could stay somewhere else. At that point, he became a little nicer and suggested that we upgrade to a 'city view' room. I had a broken foot in a cast and really just wanted to see a few sights in Boston, so I agreed. The second room was awful too...even with the 'city-view'. I decided we would stay just so we could drop our luggage and go out for dinner. Robert stared at me as I left and I really felt that he should be in anything other than hospitality! Got home today and unpacked and started organising receipts, etc. I opened the envelope from Harborside Inn and found that I had been charged 2 times the original amount quoted. An upgrade from one terrible room to another crappy room with a 'city-view' that consisted of a few buildings that blocked all other views! I will be fighting these excessive charges and would tell people to run from this Inn! It's a 2 out of 10 with a sour attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Modern mixed with old, quiet and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel when my son graduated from Northeastern College. We stayed in an "atrium" room and it was comfortable, with natural light streaming in and quiet! The rooms are a nice comfy mix of old brick walls and modern (but not cold) furniture. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I stayed there with my 25 year old daughter and my late 70's year old parents and we all loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay at the Harborside Inn again”
Reviews.Author: robyn76
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have an annual pub crawl around Faneuil Hall for St. Patty's day. Now that we're no longer a cab ride away from Downtown, we have stayed overnight in Boston the last couple of years. I decided to try the Harborside Inn this year and was not disappointed. After watching the room rate for a couple weeks, I was able to book for $99 (best deal in Boston!). They were able to provide early check in and the staff was very nice. We had an atrium view, which looks out on the brick interior of the hotel. Nothing special, but it's a little cheaper than the room with a city view. The room was clean and the bathroom was a good size. Very nice flat screen tv with a good amount of channels. The two downsides to this hotel is the parking situation and lack of room service. You can receive a discounted rate at a garage that's a two minute walk down State Street and that's probably the best price you'll find in that area. Most of the hotels in Boston have additional fees for parking, so be prepared to pay no matter which hotel you choose. Also, the Harborside does not have a restaurant onsite, so there is no room service available. Having said that, you have Faneuil Hall just a few steps away with plenty of options for meals, snacks and beverages. There is also a 24-hour convenience store in the same building as the hotel. If you're just looking for clean place to rest your head and relax a little during your stay in Boston, this is a great option in a convenient location. If you're looking for a place with a lot of amenities and pampering, I would recommend shelling out some big bucks for one of the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Boston centre”
Reviews.Author: TravellerGU14
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for one night on our tour of New England for before heading to NYC. The hotel is in a really good location in downtown Boston close to everything (that we needed). The staff here were friendly and very helpful directing you to places near the hotel. So many great places to eat, drink and be merry!! Although there is no bar or restaurant, that isn't a problem, as above there are so many places near by to eat and drink of if you want to stay the rooms have an array of take-away menu's for places that deliver to the hotel. The lobby has a good number of free internet PC's with printers and free WiFi which covers the rooms too. Tea and coffee making is also available in the lobby which was a great bonus, as well as an ice & soda machine in the basement. The reception loaned me a bottle opener which i appreciated....the little things make a difference! Our room was spottless - Although it was an atrium room, so no natural light which didn't bother us & thats what we had booked, but could become annoying if you were staying a few days and had to go out to look at the weather! That said , the room was one of the best I have stayed in - Huge TV linked to a CD / DVD player / Radio + amp which also worked in the (very modern) bathroom, with a vol control on the bathroom wall - Great feature. If you are visiting Boston you wont go wrong booking here, I'm sure you will be happy with the quality, service & location at the Harborside!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: powdering
Reviews.Content: Harborside Inn is a really charming hotel in a great location on State Street. The room really benefited from the high ceilings which gave it a sense of being larger than it really was (but that's not to say it was small!). In-room wifi is much appreciated, with free printing facilities at the computers in the lobby. Free tea and coffee 24 hours a day was also a bonus. It was a little on the pricey side for us, in comparison to the other hotels we stayed in the US during the same trip, but we have no compaints and would definitely recommend it to anyone considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck....”
Reviews.Author: franci329
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided a week before going to stay in Boston for our 6th year anniversary. Not sure if there was a big event going on but most hotels were booked and if not they were way too expensive. I found the Harborside on Travelocity. Never looked at tripadvisor so we took our chances. The Harboside Inn is located on State street. They do have a discount at a local parking garage but we had already parked. Big mistake- $30 overnight when it could have been $11 for the night. The old building is very charming, minutes from Faneuil Hall, great restauarants and the waterfront. Our room was a King size bed, pretty good view of the waterfront. Bathroom a bit small but all in all this hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good price, good but great amenities”
Reviews.Author: adhali
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference a few weeks ago and it worked out great. There is literally a T-station in front of the hotel, lots of tourist stuff (freedom trail, aquarium, harbor tours) on your doorstep, short walk to north end, etc. So you can pretty much walk or 't' to wherever you need to go. The room was small but nice. Only minor problems were in the bathroom. No shelve or soap/shampoo holder in the bathroom so I had to either sit stuff on the floor or outside the stall on the toilet. Also the only towel holder was placed such that the towels (when hung) touched the toilet seat (not the tank). Weird. Was nice, clean and comfy bed so I was happy. One other note, the 'atrium' rooms face an atrium that is just the interior of this very small hotel. So the atrium view is essentially looking at the elevator shaft 10 feet away. While waiting for the elevator I could see right into peoples rooms if their blinds were open. City view rooms were not loud for me and was there wednesday through sunday. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Fin_10
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a very central location. There are loads of good bars and restaurants nearby. Also the rooms are very clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cornhusker17
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent two nights here and had a great experience. It is a smaller and quiet hotel conveniently located for walking through downtown, the Freedom Trail, and the waterfront. The price was very reasonable for this area. The coffee was always available (and good) in the lobby and the bathroom was very nice. One complaint would be that the only ice machine was in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: BerlinPeaceFrog
Reviews.Content: Very good value and a superb location. It's convinient for the airport, AquariumT- station right next door, freedom trail and harbor are in walking distance, Qunicy Market offers lot's of choices for meals. Take the Inner Harbor Ferry (F4) for a great skyline view.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerofNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Harborside Inn in late March as flooding in Rhode Island cancelled all Amtrak trains out of Boston. Concierge at Train station recommended hotel - which I wanted close to the station for a possible early departure the next day if trains started running again. One problem - concierge said hotel was 3 blocks away from station and along the harbor. He called and I spoke w/ hotel - they had a room that faced the harbor and was reasonable. I said fine. Pushed my rolling bag and brief case for at least 3/4 of a mile to find the hotel across a main thoroughfare from hotels blocking the view of the harbor (Marriott). Nice place though - family run, front desk were conscientious and asked questions and gave directions about dining/etc. Renovated hotel in an old brick facade - rooms had regular keys for locks. Simple room - nice queen bed, two night stands, a small round table w/ 2 chairs and a sofa. Large tube style television w/ a DVD player and stereo system - all placed in a shelf unit. No bureau or cabinet, just open shelves for your belongings. Closet had an iron/ironing board and some shelf-unit and hangers. Bathroom was very compact - walk-in shower (no tub), not much counter space around the sink. Free wifi and computers in the lobby. Free coffee in the lobby. No restaurant, though hotel surrounded by bars and restaurants in both sides. Convenience store two doors down. No obvious parking, though parking was available down the street. Hotel was very nice and in excellent location if I was sightseeing. Surrounded by bars, on the weekend the noise from the street might be a problem. Went less than a block and I found Faneuil Hall and found a take-out dinner there. Didn't walk across the main road to check out the harbor. From my room, if I looked closely I could see a bit of the docks where a few boats were tied up next to the Marriott - that was the harbor view. Overall, a nice emergency hotel, close to the train station at an affordable price. Excellent location if you wanted to see the local tourist attractions. I checked and no room had two queen bed setups, if you wanted to bring a family of four for example. However, my sofa opened up to a sleeper sofa. Might bring my family back to this hidden gem - probably save a good $100-120 from the rates at the Marriott or other chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Brownz
Reviews.Content: After a little lottery win at xmas I decided that a long weekend in Boston would be nice, the Harborside Inn looked to be a perfectly located hotel. Getting there from the Airport couldn't have been easier - Shuttle Bus from the terminal to the water taxi stop - Pressed the button on the water taxi intercom - "I'll be with you in 5 buddy", and low and behold a chequered water taxi comes speeding across the harbour. $10 and 5mins later I'm on the jetty by the Long Wharf, I cross the street and the Harborside Inn is in front of me - 2 mins walk at the maximum. Check-in was a breeze and staff were courteous and friendly. The room was large, clean and overlooked a back street. There was a nice large flatpanel HD TV and DVD Player all hooked up to a home cinema amp which was nice. The bathroom was nice - with a lovely large tiled shower cubicle - big enough to have a party in. The bed was comfy with lovely soft and fluffy pillows. The hotel itself doesn't have any dining facilities, but due to its location - that is not a problem. If you fancy a snack then there is a 24hrs convenience store next door - turn left out of the front door. For breakfast you turn right outside the front door and you have Nunzios - serving all the usual American breakfast classics. If you fancy a brewski - then there is a bar called the GoodBar right next door - this also serves standard bar snacks. All these are in the same building as the hotel so walking times not given (under 10seconds !!) For evening meals you're spoilt for choice, turn right out of the hotel and there is a LegalSeafood about a minute away towards the Aquarium - also the rather excellent Chart House is behind the Long Wharf hotel - try the coconut shrimp and follow it with the Scrod Sandwich - you wont be dissapointed. Turn left out of the hotel and about 30secs later you're in Fanueil Hall - which has more restaurants than you can shake a stick at - the food hall in the market is mindblowing. Around the outside are more trad restaurants, including a Wagamama and a replica "Cheers" bar which has some of the best burgers I've tasted. The Union Street Oyster House is on the other side of Fanueil Hall which is a must visit for anyone staying in Boston. The hotel does belong to a takeaway scheme that lets you order dishes from loads of local restaurants for delivery to your hotel room if you don't want to venture outside ! To summerise - clean & comfy hotel - well priced and in the perfect location - I'll certainely be going back !

Reviews.Title: “More Then What You Paid For”
Reviews.Author: worlddreamer5
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was in the middle of everything and if you wanted to go a little farther away to something the subway station was right outside. When I booked the room I thought we was getting a small room for the amount that we paid. It was not only big but it had high ceilings too which was nice. The people at the desk where great too they gave us tips on where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, COOL BUILDING”
Reviews.Author: katethehiker
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a $99.00 per night winter special via Expedia.com. Beautiful hotel, although the pictures on-line make the rooms & lobby look much bigger. Loved the exposed brick and modern fixtures. We had an "atrium view" room. Turns out, the "artium" we were facing seemed to be a 12 X 12 shaft that faced the other rooms directly (keep your shades drawn). Next time, we'll try a city view room. The location was fantastic. We walked to everything. Front desk staff were very dry & boring. Not high on the friendly meter. They could use some perky lessons.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: sage56
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Boston, to celebrate our 22nd wedding anniversary and we had enjoyable stay at the Haborside Inn of Boston. It doesn't have all fancy amenities as the other major hotels. But if your looking for quiet and romantic weekend this is the place to stay. This hotel is in a perfect location and within minutes of everything, like subway, Quincy Market and Faneuil Hall. The staff was nice and helpful and the rooms were comfortable and clean. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We would stay there again. Regards, CTP

Reviews.Title: “Top spot”
Reviews.Author: BarnsburyBlake
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a perfect location. Staff are apathetic, but helpful when required. The rooms are big, with all mod cons apart from a safe. It's not luxury, but it's clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Neegi
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this small hotel! It is located just off the Interstate, so only required a couple of blocks of driving in the city. Very easy for small town drivers. We parked the car upon arrival and it was not needed until we left to return home. The Hop On- Hop Off Trolley is located right across the street along with New England Aquarium. The T is literally right outside the front door. Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall and The Old State House are just a couple blocks away. Many choices for dining are all nearby. The room, while nothing special, was comfortable and clean and perfect for a weekend get-away. We chose a city view room and were pleased by the lights of the city by night and the early sun in the morning. The window treatment did allow a lot of light in the room which wasn't the greatest for sleeping...but I thought that was a trade off for choosing city view room. Because we chose to travel in winter we were able to take advantage of a winter sale on the price of the room...great deal. We also took advantage of the winter rates for the Hop On- Hop Off Trolley...two days for the price of one. The staff was helpful and allowed us to check -in much earlier than the normal check-in time. We had trouble with the Wi-Fi in our room, but there was bank of computers in the lobby and there was never a wait. We were very pleased with our entire stay and would certainly plan to stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Loaction”
Reviews.Author: falker014
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean hotel. Perfect location...literally a 30 second walk from Quincy Market, 2 minute walk to the aquarium, and the T (subway) is directly outside the frint door. Perfect spot to stay if you want to get around Beantown. Great restaurants within 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: JennyDoodles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights over New Year's Eve weekend. Paid $500 in total including all taxes and thought it was a great deal considering the excellent location (walking distance to Fanueil Hall and right by the T). Staff was very nice and helpful when we asked them questions. Rooms are small, but clean and there was plenty of room in the bathroom for our toiletries. We stayed in an atrium room by the elevator and had NO problem with noise at all whatsoever. We will stay here again when in Boston and parking was only 2 - 3 short blocks away and only cost us $58 for our entire stay. All in all a great value in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hreilly
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying 3 nights in this hotel. Excellent Location for anyone visiting Boston and the tourist areas. parking in nearby garage at a discount for vistors staying at this hotel. Stayed in classic atrium room which had free internet access, large lcd television, nice bathroom with large shower. no in room cofffee/ tea making facilites but free coffee/ tea in lobby area 24 hours daily. comfortable bed and quiet area. recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a mid price comfortable hotel in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Come to this castle and get treated like a king!!”
Reviews.Author: offdutyninja_9
Reviews.Content: We came to town from California and this hotel was perfect!! The central location made it easy to get around the city. The room was clean comfortable and relaxing. Especially the pillows!! I wanted to take them home! The staff was extremely helpful finding great food and music at night. I would recommend this lovely establishment to anyone who's going to Boston for the true Boston experience!! Thanks Haborside!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Even Better Price”
Reviews.Author: Jopis
Reviews.Content: Imagine staying in the heart of downtown Boston for under $190 per night. Harborside Inn is the only place I know of that offers that much value. A stone's throw from the Boston Garden, Historic North End, and every form of transportation you can think of (including subway, commuter train, high-speed ferry, major Interstates) this cozy place is a bargain for anyone staying in town that needs to stay connected to everything while they're on the go.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and price”
Reviews.Author: eggtmt
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to take the train to Boston for the night. I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and thought we'd give it a try. We have stayed in Boston many times and are quite familiar with many of the hotels. This hotel was in an excellent location. We were able to walk from North Station although there is a T stop right outside the hotel if you prefer the train. The hotel is right next to Quincy Market and within walking distance to the Theater Dist.. Little Italy , Beacon Hill, Newbury St. and Copley Plaza. Boston is much easier on foot than by car so leave your car at home. The rooms were very comfortableand spacious and the price was right. Very friendly staff. There are free computers in the lobby along with free coffee. There are hundreds of resteraunts and bars within walking distance. This is an excellent value and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: cajeju
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not advisable. The only things that are positive are the central location and the fact that the rooms were clean. The bathroom we had (#215) was very small, there was no place even to put toilet articles anywhere. The room itself was also quite small â€“ the biggest thing was the TV. No safe for valuables, no fridge for drinks was available. The so called atrium is a joke â€“ the rooms look either into a small shaft above the reception (#215) or into the lobby (#214). No windows can be opened and the ventilation/AC makes a lot of noise, even when turned off. Room #214 (and all the rooms above it) is especially poor â€“ it looks right onto the lobby area and as a result all though the night a lot of noise carries up. Worst of all â€“ vibrations either from the AC or something else let the floor and even the bed vibrate! No cafÃ© is available. Definitely the worst of all hotels we had on our trip through New England.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with a nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Boyo101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights late Oct '09. Rooms were generally well presented & clean . For the price is ok for value. Free 24hr internet access via wifi as well as the computers located in the lobby. Also free tea and coffee access in the lobby. The staff were always very helpful. Location wise it is within walking distance of Boston South Train Station and Logan Airport is only 15 mins away via the blue line T subway which is on the hotel doorstep. There are a nice selection of places to dine as well as bars go to in the evening all within a few minutes walking distance of the hotel. New england aquarium is just across the road together with a pier where u can go on a ferry ride if u fancy going on a harbour cruise. The trolley bus tour stop is also across the road if u want to go and visit the sites in the city. Would definitely recommend to people looking for a pleasant stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy hotel, unhelpful staff, and the parking is a long way.”
Reviews.Author: digitalhen
Reviews.Content: I don't normally feel motivated one or the other to write a review, but this place really pushed me to sign straight in to TripAdvisor. We had high hopes after reading the reviews, unfortunately, this wasn't to be. On the plus side, the location is great - everything you could want is easy to get to, and there are plenty of things to eat nearby. The inside of the room was ok - decent, but very sparse, furnishing. The bed was good, but otherwise unremarkable. It gave the distinct impression that it had been furnished on a budget. There were no curtains, just an old set of blinds. And now for the bad side of the trip. Parking was not too close to the hotel (it's at 75 State Street, almost 300 yards away), and was quite expensive at about $38 a night for self park. The staff were polite but generally unhelpful. They didn't seem interested in helping us with our bags, or giving us any indication where anything was in relation to the hotel. Things came to a head on Friday night. Our room (306) was very, very noisy with music from nearby in to the early hours. With a bit of exploring, it became clear this was coming from the nightclub next door. The front desk said there was nothing they could do, there were no free rooms in the hotel, and the club was immediately below our room. They're open until 2am on a Friday night. Brilliant. We were looking forward to a quiet trip to Boston, but this hotel completely failed us. Do yourself a favor, and avoid this place at all costs. There much better places to be had for just a few $ more.

Reviews.Title: “Harborside rocks!”
Reviews.Author: pnm563
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sep 09, really attractive building. Makes a change from the template dullness of chain hotels. Rooms clean and quiet, big TV plenty of space to move around. Free internet access and tea/coffee making facilities downstairs. Can park outside if you need to and then get discount at car park 2 minutes round the corner. Great location for the harbour, aquarium, custom house (to go up the tower for a view, 2pm guided each day) and Quincy market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mjstrout
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to a king-size bed with inner-court view. Room had great flat screen tv and very nice shower. Location is excellent for the Quincy Marketplace/Fanueil Hall. Very convenient to subway.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 4 Days in Boston...this hotel is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: the12thmanseattle
Reviews.Content: we had never been to Boston before, and we decided to go for 4 days, to sight see and get in a Red Sox game...this hotel was great! Awesome location, very affordable, large rooms, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ccm76
Reviews.Content: We (young couple) stayed at this hotel about 2 weeks ago and we enjoyed our stay very much. Our room was on the 7th floor and we had a great view of the harbor and the city. The hotel is walking distance from the city's main attractions and the subway station is very close by (this was very convenient as we took public transportation to get around). The only downside of the hotel is that they do not offer any breakfast, but at least there's coffee. Overall, it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place In a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DERetired
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our three night (8/14-16) stay at the Harborside Inn. The lobby and room were very clean and well-kept. Those at the desk were always helpful with our questions. I took the advise of others about the outside noise and booked an atrium room on the 3rd floor. It was very quiet and, although there was a minimum of natural light, it was never a problem There was an antique brick wall behind the bed, unusual bedside lighting, nice bathroom, big wide screen TV on the wall, and a table with chairs. A small refrigerator would have been helpful, but we got around it with ice (machine located in the basement). Also a nice touch would have been a dimmer on the ceiling light. For the inexorbitant price and great location, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's easy walking distance to the harbor, great big and little restaurants, and all of the action going on around Faneuil Hall. The freedom trail runs right in front of the place and the T is just a short distance away. Take the Duck Tour!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sara1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the city center and to the aquarium. The metro station in on the opposide side of the street. A little bit noisy during the night cause the pubs along the street. Atrium rooms are more quite.

Reviews.Title: “Good location bad location!”
Reviews.Author: Doofler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a simple city hotel with no general amenties outside free coffee and internet access in the lobby. I chose a city facing room which was a mistake. The room was smallish but okay. It lacked a fridge and safe but included an ironing board and hair dryer and a very large flat screen tv. The bathroom was very tatty, the sink was split and old, the general condition was poor and the bath had in my opinion not been cleaned as evidenced by the number of rogue hair present in the bath! The main problem with the room was that it did not have sound proof windows. The hotel is in between a loud bar and a nightclub and it was extremely noisy on the first night (I was on the 6th floor) until 2 am. I purchased earplugs for the second night! The location is ideal for donwtown Boston and is very close (maybe too close) to lots of bars and restaurants and has easy access to the Port for the water taxi to the airport. I would have been satisfied at half the price but at $240 a night it is a complete rip off and like many US hotel very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; Location makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: littletm
Reviews.Content: The Harborside is a "no frills" hotel with a great location close to Fanueil Hall, Quincy Market, Aquarium, Little Italy, etc. The location is really outstanding. That, alone, make it an excellent value. It's a clean, recently remodeled hotel. There is no restaurant, no room service, but the rooms are adequate and reasonably appointed. It's got great access to the subway, too. This is the kind of hotel that uses plastic cups and paper coffee cups. Hot water for the shower is a little questionable at some times. Rooms are quiet. TV is wide, flat panel. Space for your clothing is very adequate. Desk staff is very helpful and courteous. Housekeeping does well at cleaning the room, but they don't seem to dispose of used cups or empty the ice bucket. Wireless internet access is free and easy and they also have a bank of computers in the lobby for guest use. If you're looking for location/value and don't put a lot of emphasis on "luxury", this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: MTB1984
Reviews.Content: I absolutely enjoyed my stay at the Harborside Inn! It was in the middle of everything, right out front was a blue line T stop, across the street was Quiny Market, a short walk to the harbor and aquarium! The rooms were clean and quiet. I would definitely recommend this hotel to adult travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotal for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: DDChase
Reviews.Content: This is a very convienently located hotel in the downtown district. Simple access to all parts of the city via the "T" , water taxi, or cab. Walking works pretty well too! The room was nice as well as the staff. The only down-side is the lack of food service, but with the abundance of restaurants in the area, it's hard to fault them for sticking to what they know. I wouldn't venture into food in that area, if I weren't prepared to offer top-knotch fare.

Reviews.Title: “no frills,immaculate room, shabby furniture in lobby”
Reviews.Author: cookiegirlnewjersey
Reviews.Content: the location was perfect to sites and the T. the staff was courteous and very helpful, however ,there was no one to help with our luggage checking in or out. the room was rather small but immaculate.the furniture in the lobby was frayed and really needed to be replaced. we went to the marriott long wharf ,had a delicious breakfast ,and decided to cool off there in their beautiful lobby for a few hours. that worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a gorgeous room!”
Reviews.Author: KHarp
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We got a great price on the room so we honestly did not expect much out of it and were totally shocked when we saw the hotel and our room. The room was spacious and beautiful, with a brick wall, huge windows overlooking the financial district, a large flat screen tv and much more. The location is perfect - near Long Wharf and Faneuil Hall. We loved it so much that we stayed an extra night!

Reviews.Title: “Smart Choice for location and cost”
Reviews.Author: TravelDelaware
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights and really don't understand the one or two thumbs down ratings. This place is perfectly situated for about anyone. It is right in the middle of the fun of the historic district and a 10 minute walk (and a nice walk) to the T to get anywhere. I traveled daily to Harvard in about 30 minutes (train and walking time). The room was very clean and the staff friendly. The criticism about noise outside was valid, but not a deal breaker. Don't expect a lobby bar or mini fridge. This is a very simple set up. But the room was very nice and all the food and beverage one would need is within a few steps of the front door.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location and a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dianej
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel while touring Boston with friends. The location couldn't be beat! We saved on parking by driving to the Newton, MA subway station and parked there for three nights, then taking the "T" into Boston for only two dollars a person. By making one train change, we walked out of the subway at the Aquarium stop to find ourselves just steps away from the hotel entrance. The hotel is close to both Quincy Market and the fantastic New England Aquarium and Harborwalk and, since Boston is such a walkable city, close enough to walk to just about everywhere (Little Italy, Boston Commons, either direction on the Freedom Trail, etc.). The hotel was very quiet and comfortable with a spacious room and bathroom. There was round-the-clock coffee and tea service in the lobby along with two computers for guest to use to access the internet. The front desk was helpful also in assisting us in making reservations for a recommended restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would not recommend, apathetic staff, parking disaster.”
Reviews.Author: maryh8
Reviews.Content: The only good things I can say about Harborside Inn, Boston, is that the room was clean and it is in a convenient location to the waterfront. We travel a great deal and the staff was probably the most unhelpful we have ever encountered. Today, I asked if they could provide driving directions to the JFK Museum. The woman at the desk, on a personal phone call, just answered "No". That was it. We had other similar encounters with this unhelpful staff and also observed others. The hotel has no parking and the recommended parking facility was a few blocks away and quite expensive (about $60.00 for two days - with the discount!). When you arrive there are no directions regarding where to park to check in, what to do, etc. No staff member offers to help with your luggage or provides any guidance whatsoever. We saw the person checking in after us actually receive a parking ticket from an unsympathetic meter maid. If you are planning to stay in Boston, near the Financial Area, stay in the Marriott instead. By the time you pay for parking, the rates will probably be very similar. Don't travel to Boston on vacation if you are looking for nightlife other than bars. There is not much else to do, once you take one evening boat cruise. In addition, good manners do not seem to be pervasive in Boston. Very few people every say "please" or "thank you".

Reviews.Title: “Good location but loud at night!”
Reviews.Author: UKRobers
Reviews.Content: Location is great and reasonably priced. Stayed on a Friday night and room was on the 3rd floor facing the main street. There's a couple of bars directly connected to the hotel and this causes a problem on a Friday (and probably other nights). The noise was so loud that I double checked the windows weren't open. Unfortunately they were firmly shut, they just didn't provide enough resistance to the jungle that was outside. Real shame as the hotel is nicely kitted out. I would only recommend that people stay in one of the rooms to the rear of the building which maybe called Atrium rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, fantastic, with a side of weird”
Reviews.Author: cycle070
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Boston for the Fourth of July weekend and we stayed at Harborside Inn. We decided kind of last minute to go to Boston and with doing a little research, I found the Harborside Inn. It was very reasonably priced and the location was MORE than perfect. Literally across from Faneuil Hall, tons of pubs, restaurants, shopping. There is even a bar right next door and a little 24-hr store too. The T station right out side the hotel is very convenient as well. You are about a five minute walk from the Gov't Center T stop too. We didn't really know what to expect when we walked into the hotel, but when we opened the door we were pleasantly surprised, and a little taken aback. We had an atrium view, which basically meant we had no windows to the outside, which was great when we wanted to sleep in after our long night, but not so great when you are getting ready and you need to have every light on in the place! The room was absolutely huge, high ceilings and gigantic bed! There was a really big flat screen TV hanging on the wall and there was a really nice sound system with an amp/receiver(FM radio, which plays in the bathroom as well), and even a DVD player in case you get stuck on a rainy weekend. I even think they rent movies downstairs for you. There was a freakishly large mirror in our room too, a little strange. The room just felt so empty with nothing on the walls and the high ceilings, but other than that it was perfect. The staff was extremely helpful with anything we needed. They had directions printed up for both walking and subway. There is however no parking on site, which is kind of a bummer because you have to drive around the corner to park at the State Street garage. But, the hotel DOES give you a discount on the parking, just REMEMBER YOUR TICKET! Overall, this place was perfect for what we needed, and provided us with a very pleasant stay in Boston. The hotel was extremely clean and we really had no problems. If you have the choice, try to get a street view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: vallelde
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Boston with my teenage daughter in June and stayed at the Harborside Inn. Room was small, but modern and clean. Plenty of towels, flat screen tv, lovely bathroom. Our room looked out into an inside atrium so that was a drawback but I knew it going in. For more money, you could have an outside view room. Lobby very nice, fresh coffee, tea, etc. 24/7. Parking is selfpark and around the corner. Not too bad...around $25.00. For the night with parking and taxes the total was under $200 which is great for Boston. Once again, the location is the key. You can walk to the waterfront, NorthEnd, Fanueil Hall very quickly. Would stay here again. If had unlimited budget would definately go with somewhere else in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Hard_Woman
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for seeing the city, within walking distance from all the key attractions and restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient if arriving Logan”
Reviews.Author: skipaway
Reviews.Content: Off the plane, out to ground transportation, shuttle bus to subway (the T), buy a ticket, hop on, get off at Aquarium (second stop), Maybe 20 minutes and $2.00 from plane you are at the Harborside. Don't miss it--the glass enclosure for the subway stairs kind of hides the entrance. I had spent a little extra for a city view room, not wanting an internal windowless room. This is not necessary; for one thing, the inner rooms have windows that open to a well lighted atrium, and secondly, the windows were so high I had to stand on a chair to see out (or to open/close the blinds). In fact, you might prefer the inner rooms as they would be quieter. My initial impression was good since I showed up at 9 a.m. intending to check my bag and go sightsee. However, the clerk at reception said they had a room open if I wanted to check in right away. (This may explain the view, and is sure OK with me) I had room 610. There are two stairs to negotiate in the hall of the 6th floor, and, curiously, two in the room itself. Walking in, the closet is on the left, bathroom on the right, two stairs straight ahead up to room. Queen bed, 4 pillows. Nice flat screen TV, big, tho' I didn't measure it. There's a round table with two chairs. Lighting adequate for reading at table or in bed, and more electric outlets than are customary in most hotels and they were easily accessable. The only exposed brick I found was in the closet (!) along with an iron, ironing board, and luggage rack. The bathroom had shampoo, shower gel, mouthwash, and body lotion. Shower only, with a major water saver shower-head. Plenty of hot water, though, so what if it takes a little longer to rinse off? There is also a hairdryer. No in-room safe, and no coffee maker. There is coffee available (free) 24/7 in the lobby which also has two computers to use and a printer so you can check in on-line and get your BPs. There is also free wireless. There was a nice guide book in the room for your use while a guest and I really came to appreciate that little book. I'm sorry I can't recall the name--it was a small DK or Insight style with the "10 Best" of various areas of Boston. The room was very clean with the exception of an open, used, bar of soap on the sink, with the wrapper in the trash. I presume it was a late check-out who slipped in after the maid had cleaned. There is no on-site restaurant, but you couldn't be better located for places to eat or things to do. Loved: the location Concerns: getting up at night to go to the bathroom and forgetting about those two steps. (I left the BR light on, just in case) Paid: $178 incl tax. Being from the mid-west, it's hard for me to recognize this as a great value, but after doing some research it is good value for Boston, especially considering location and access to transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, contemporary style, nice amenities and great location!”
Reviews.Author: llrogers01
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly for business and generally stay in cookie cutter chain hotels to watch cost and collect program points. I was a little skeptical about staying at The Harborside without a personal reference, but am happy to say I enjoyed my stay from the moment I entered the room. Cleanliness is huge for me, and they do a wonderful job at The Harborside. Comfortable bed, nice linens, walk in shower, not to mention the bonus of the flat screen TV, stereo and lighting. Oh, and did I mention the great location! I will definately stay at The Harborside again if my business brings me to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, good value, courteous service.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyGuyC
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night there as we flew in to Logan but were staying on Cape Cod for the week. The hotel is only about 10 minutes from the airport and is just a couple blocks from the historic Quincy Market and Fanuiel Hall. We had an interior room and it was quiet and comfortable. There is 24-hour coffee and tea service in the lobby and free computers to check e-mail, etc. (free Wi-Fi if you brought a laptop). It is a bit tricky to find at first and there are no signs saying that you can park right in front of the hotel to unload luggage and check in but that is what you are supposed to do. Parking anywhere in Boston is expensive but hotel guests do get a discount at a parking garage about a block away. Lots of places to eat in the Quincy Market area including the simulated Cheers bar and Durgin-Park restaurant. (This is the one that used to feature the old-time waiters who would insult you freely while taking and delivering your order. Sadly they no longer do that.) The subway (known locally as the "T") is a few steps from the front of the hotel which means that you can get anywhere in the greater Boston area quickly and cheaply. All in all, unless you can afford a high-end, full service hotel at about double the price of this one, you would have a hard time beating this hotel for convenience for the Boston area traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Pacofox
Reviews.Content: The rooms were well equiped, with great hidef tvs and even free guides to Boston. But notice I said 'rooms'. We were given a room at the 8th floor, and when we tried to sleep there was an unbereable noise that sounded like an air conditioning fan just inside our heads. We asked for another room, wich they kindly offered us, but no one helped us moving the luggage and I had to dress to go down to the desk and get the key. The other room, at the same floor, was good. And, then again, the location is great. But beware of the noise. Be sure to ask and check it when you enter the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SUGARPEE
Reviews.Content: This hotel has fantastic proximity to Fanueil Hall, The North End, and The Waterfront. We were delighted with the room(queen atrium). Especially the surround sound stereo!! That was a plus. The bathroom had slate floor and shower(speaker in there as well to hear the stereo was great!) Our bed was on a platform which you stepped up into. The wood underneath and surrounding the bed made a racket, it got to be very comical. Comfortable bed and furnishings, nice television with lots of channels from which to choose. Lots of restaurants in the area within walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location!”
Reviews.Author: empty002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal for Boston. The location is awesome. Easy access to public transport, if you need to get somewhere. There is a garage to park in down the street, so that was very easy. There are lots of great bars and dining areas around. The hotel is very nice. The rooms are a good size. The bathroom is very standard, but good. The hotel was very quiet. There were lots of other couples staying there. They had a computer in the lobby to use for free. If anyone is complaining about this hotel, I can't understand why. I really loved staying here and would again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: tomobtb
Reviews.Content: This place is Great. we checked in late evening and the guy on the front desk was really nice. we were upgraded free of charge to a bigger room. we were given a King atrium room. this had no windows to the outside but overlooked the inside of the hotel. this was okay. the brickwork in the building was awesome very nice. the room was great, very clean and had Huge tv and sound system, music in shower which was great. i would recommend this hotel it is close to town and other stuff, right next to a T (subway stop) and places to eat and drink. Staff were very cool.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: DanielJW
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the cheapest hotels on Expedia and, after reading some reviews, I wasn't expecting too much. However, this place is amazing, the rooms are large, equipped with 42" plasma, surround sound system, fantastic slate bathroom and very comfortable bed. Convenient for The Cheers Bar (kind of the local, though expensive). I would totally recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid: Cozy clean hotel, but with fatal flaws”
Reviews.Author: you222
Reviews.Content: My wife and i researched this hotel in depth, and noticed several comments about traffic noise, noise from rowdy party-goers, and the music throb of the adjacent clubs. We decided to take the trade the risk for the reasonable rate and convenient location, booked an interior atrium room to at least avoid the street and foot traffic noise, and hoped the club noise was no big deal. Upon check-in, we were offered an "upgrade" to a city view room. I voiced concern about the reviews of high noise for street-facing rooms, but the manager stressed the 8th floor should be well clear of that. Bad idea. Extreme traffic noise (mostly cars honking due to traffic snarls on surrounding streets), police sirens, very loud crowds, and an incessant throb of techno beat from next-door club. And it continued past 4am. When i voiced my concern the following morning to the person who checked us in, he did apologize, and admitted the noise was indeed high on thu-sat nights, and even the atrium rooms still get significant nightclub throb. Would have been nice to get that honest assessment before we wasted our evening and money. Hopefully i can save you the bother. So, the desk help was extremely helpful (but we feel less than honest), the rooms were very clean and comfortably furnished, but none of that makes a difference if you're trying to relax. We could forgive until midnight perhaps, but past 4am? No way folks. If we were much younger and so inebriated it didn't matter, and the rooms were free, well perhaps a good fit, but for anything else avoid avoid AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bostonorbust
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week in Boston and loved all of it. We arrived by bus at South Station and quickly and easily navigated the T to the Harborside with no trouble. Check in (and check out) were quick and easy. When I booked the room, I figured the City View rooms facing State St. would have a nicer view than the rooms facing out from the back of the hotel, and my request was accomodated. On Friday and Saturday evenings when a line was forming in front of the bar two doors down, the waiting crowd got a little loud for a couple of hours. We could also hear horns beeping occasionally ( I think this wouldn't be a problem in an Atrium room.) Our room had two brick walls; the new construction is drywall. The bed was spacious and very comfortable, as were the pillows. This was easily the best hotel bed I have ever slept in. A hook in the bathroom for hanging clothes would have been nice. The room was perfectly clean every day when we returned from our outings. The free coffee in the lobby saved us probably $100 over the course of the week. There are plenty of places to eat within two or three blocks of the hotel, and we chose to eat at a different place each time. There is also a convenience store on the same block.
