I used the lobby computer twice to check email without having to wait. Even though the hotel was busy, we only heard other guests in the hall once. It was nice having a stereo in the room. My husband and I are not fancy people; we were looking for a clean, quiet, conveniently located hotel (a place to sleep and shower), and we got that and more at the Harborside Inn. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not always trust Frommers”
Reviews.Author: KDSLondon
Reviews.Content: Difficult to get luggage from taxi to reception no kerbside pickup many thanks to the guy standing outside the bar next door who helped us with our cases! Had to request help with luggage from reception. Stayed in top floor room for six nights, very dark , weird layout & air conditioning with no info re: local area,phone directory,safety instructions etc : never got on internet as people seem to hog it. Positive side great location, bad value for top floor rooms compared with New York facilities. DKS London

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_Casey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I've stayed here several times. Location is perfect: literally outside the "Aquarium" Subway Stop. Within walking distance to: Faniel Hall, Quincy Market, shopping, Boston Commons, Beacon Hill, Freedom Trail & about a 15 minute walk to "The North End" - great restaurants! Hotel has always been clean & quite. Have not eaten on site. We fly in and never rent a car. You can take a bus from the airport to the subway. And the subway to just about anywhere. Don't miss the Hauolocaust Memorial (outside) near one end of the market. (sorry for the mis-spelling) Breakfast can be hard to find - head to Quincy Market for a bagel or eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and simple”
Reviews.Author: ann5151
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night only and have no complaints. It was very reasonably priced and the location is great. The room was simple and clean. I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Loud Disrupting Sleep Next Door”
Reviews.Author: fizzeler
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice set up, but I just realized that there's a nice loud club next door (which normally I'd be happy to be at), but with the week I just had partying elsewhere, the "I could bring up some ear plugs" answer from the front desk just doesn't cut it for the $130 plus tax I just paid to get some REST. BEWARE THE TIMING OF YOUR STAY.

Reviews.Title: “Location LOCATION Location This PLACE IS AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: SciFiChick_Miami
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal! Literally steps away from Boston's Mass Transit, known as the "T". You are steps away from Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Quincy Market Place, The North End, The Aquarium, Pubs, restaurants, shopping, EVERYTHING. Stay here and you won't need a car. The rooms were not luxurious, BUT they were clean and SUPER comfortable. Large screen TV in all the rooms, make sure to request a city view. You can't beat watching the fog roll in off Boston Harbor! The bed was comfy, the pillows were awesome! The room had exposed brick walls, and for a Miami girl, that was a great touch. No room service, but, trust me, you won't miss it.... For what you pay one night across the street at the Marriott, you can stay a WHOLE week at the Harborside Inn. Free Wi-Fi, free use of computers/printers in the lobby add to the excellent experience. Top it all off with a VERY pleasant staff, night and day, they always had smiles for you, and were genuine.... No stuffiness here. They even stored our luggage for us after we checked out and went sightseeing. We almost DIDN'T want to review the hotel in order to keep it a secret. It's THAT wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: legaleagle50
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be better placed with easy access to the airport, the waterfront and the city centre. As all the guide books recommend I booked a city view and was a little disappointed to have a third floor room at the rear with an uninteresting view of a back street. To that extent the name Harborside is a little misleading: a pity that when I booked I had not read the review which advises asking for a room at the front on a high floor. On the other hand I don't think I would have liked one of the rooms that faces into the central well. In all other respects it was an excellent room, nicely converted and with the largest television I have ever had in a hotel (not that I watched it). The front desk was always helpful and the supply of hot coffee abundant. I have come not to expect much in the way of breakfast in American hotels so the absence of a restaurant was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Boston -”
Reviews.Author: WeloveB-Bs
Reviews.Content: Third time in Boston, second time here. One of the best prices we found - location is great - just blocks from North End, Ferries, Freedom Trail. Nice clean modern remodeled room, great front desk. Check your bags if you have a later flight and pick them up later. Only thing missing is a good sit down breakfast place that is not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: ssoliz
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Boston and this place is a gem! It is located very close to the North End as well as the Salem Ferry. The staff was very laid back and courteous. This hotels a great value and has a minimalist, yet comfortable design and vibe. I was excited to find an audio reciever in my room, which was connected to wall-mounted speakers (even one in the bathroom!) The hotel is sanwiched between two nice bars as well as near two of the best Irish pubs in town. Quincy Market is about 200 yards away, and Legal Seafood's flagship restaurant is just as close. The subway is right outside the door, so getting to Fenway or other distant attractions is easy. I have traveled all over the world, and this place is my new favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the view”
Reviews.Author: Bertty
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated close to the harbour, shops, bars, pubs, eating houses, market -in fact a really good location. Underground is outside the hotel and is easy to use. Try staying on the top floor as the view is really good. Tea and coffee is availiable all day long which is good first thing in the morning, last thing at night and when you've been out walking all day. Staff are friendly and front desk is helpful if you need advice. Cabs are easy to pick up outside the hotel and airport is not far away. The room we stayed in was spacious and clean. Towels changed daily and room tidied. The only thing I didn't like was the shower over the bath. I prefer a free standing shower. The hair-dryer was powerful and there was an iron if needed. Internet access in lobby was well used. Plenty of comfortable sofas to sit on. We would book this hotel again if we ever get the chance to return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel - good amenities and location”
Reviews.Author: ValueTravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Booking.com. Hotel is excellent value, amenities and location. Usually stayed at Omni Parker House but in the area this hotel is also excellent without the Omni price tag. Very close to tourist things and for business too. Room was good size and the renovated bathroom was a good size and great quality. The foyer coffee and internet access was also another excellent feature. I will certainly visit again and recommend to friends who do not want to have to stay in Back Bay area which has now become the hub for hotels. This is the first time I post a review after many trips but I felt that this hotel deserves to be recommended. Many guests were sensible couples or singles doing business in Boston Carmel Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Updated 2008”
Reviews.Author: LittletonTraveler094
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. It was built over 100 years ago but recently updated. The rooms are very nice, and well appropriated. Checking in is somewhat of a hassle. We had to park in a lot a block down and walk over to the hotel in the rain to find out the parking lot for the hotel was an additional block down. We were only staying one night so I imagine this would have been less of a hassle if we were there longer. The hotel is within walking distance of the Freedom Trail, which I would highly recommend. Overall it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great price!”
Reviews.Author: gingerdog2
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Boston to celebrate our 20th anniversary so we spent much time on the internet checking out hotels/locations, etc. We decided on Harborside due to the location, price, etc. We were more than happy when we arrived. First, the hotel is right across the street from the blue "t" (train) station. It was VERY convenient coming and going to the airport. Also, it is 1 block from Freedom Trail, 1 block from Faneuil Hall marketplace (with countless restaurants), and about 1 block from the harbor (and Legal Seafood Restaurant). Being so close to the Harbor, it was a piece of cake getting over to see the USS Constitution and USS Cassin on ferry for $1.70 each way. The rooms were clean and modern, though no frills. Coffee was available and fresh in the lobby and the hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in leading us to good places to visit. Also, had internet service in the lobby, which was nice since we did not have our labtop with us. Would DEFINITELY stay here again!!! Thank you Harborside for making our anniversary extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GuntersOma
Reviews.Content: Great location - across from Quincy Market and within walking distance of just about everything. T Stop directly in front of the hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff! Clean rooms...with rustic brick walls. Free internet - and two computers in lobby for your use. Delicious coffee 24/7. Absolutely the best deal in Boston! Highly recommended! We stay here every time we visit this fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Gets my Vote!”
Reviews.Author: DudleyDerv
Reviews.Content: Clean, Comfortable, Reasonably Priced. Coupled with a good location and above the Aquarium T station, I would urge you to consider this hotel if on a budget. Airport transfer to/from hotel via T was very easy and safe. Please Note: There was no DVD player or stereo in our room(Not that it bothered us) and car rental drop off and pick-up is ONLY for Enterprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: cmeme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights the end of July. We had Red Sox tickets for two nights in a row and decided to make a weekend of it. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rate for the middle of the summer was very reasonable. The hotel is very minimalistic which for the price is very acceptable. The room is clean and comfortable. We booked an atrium room because it was less expensive. I felt a little claustrophobic, but it didn't bother my husband and we were busy being tourists in our own city so we didn't spend much time there. Location is great. Everything is within walking distance and there's a T stop right outside the door!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and good size clean room”
Reviews.Author: EMDREW
Reviews.Content: Great location, next to Quincy Market and one block from the Whale Watch pier. Just two stops from the Airport via the metro. Good size rooms which were extremely clean and maintained. No breakfast but free hot drinks in reception and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel even with a young one”
Reviews.Author: rdsox0521
Reviews.Content: The only reason why this hotel doesn't get an Excellent Rating was the lack of breakfast but we knew that prior to booking....This is a great hotel for the price, you can't beat the location as it is walking distance to everything....We had a 2 yr old with us and I spoke with the staff prior to booking and they warned that they only have rooms with one bed and no roll aways or cribs....but the rooms were plenty big enough for the pack n play and it fit in the corner so it was out of the way. If you are just looking for a room and no bells and whistles in the hotel this is the place to stay. We saved over $200 staying here compared to across the street and we didn't regreat it one bit....Like I said, no onsite resturant but you a two minute walk to Quincy Market and with the food in the area who would eat at the hotel anyways.....The Rooms are exactly as shown on the website, we had an interior room which was nice and quiet, Flat screen tv, surround sound system (in the bathroom too) and an inroom DVD and VCR in the room so bring your own movies if needed.....Great room and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: elphantdesigns
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from the Harborside Inn and were pleasantly surprised. The room and bed were great, but it was a bit noisy due to traffic sounds and late night bar hopping but with the help of the handy fan in the closet (to creat white noise to drown out the sound) and closed windows it was fine. The only issues we had was that the only vending machine was in the basement and not working and someone had left "interesting" movies in the bedside drawer. Vistors to Boston should note that getting late night (after 10 pm) food is nearly impossible so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babyaim
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, Very laid back and European style. Free Tea / Coffee making facilities & supplies in foyer. Free Internet access, they have 2 computers in the foyer with a printer you just sit down and use them no pass key etc. (printer is handy as you get discount tickets for attractions online!!!) All Staff were polite and helpful. Rooms were great. We had 3 rooms (1 off which was for disabled) Each room was different. So ok we didnâ€™t have Bare brick walls as shown in all the hotel photos, But Iâ€™ve never stayed in a hotel yet where the room actually looks the brochure! Rooms were very clean, beds were huge and V. comfortable, AC worked well. In our bathroom it was a little dated, but still clean. In my parents room they had a huge bathroom with double walk in shower, which looks very recently renovated. Rooms and hotel were quite, no noise from street or other residents. Location is excellent, 2-minute walk from Long wharf where Legal Sea foods (must visited) all harbor cruises & trolley tours start from. Across the road from Fanueil Hall, Quincy market , cheers bar etc. Walking distance (even with pushing a wheelchair) from Boston Common. Had a great stay here, would definitely go back to Boston again, and would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: griz2
Reviews.Content: We selected the Harbourside because we were only having a few days in Boston and we wanted somewhere central, it was a shame that they had no where for breakfast, but there were plenty of places to get something to eat , especially as we were so close to Faneuil Hall, where the choice is mind blowing, every food you could think off. The hotel was a lovely mix of old and new, easy to find and simple check in, our room was clean and had everything we could want, even a direct dial to a restaurant and dominos pizza for those that arrived late and wanted something to eat, like us. The location could not be faulted, everywhere within walking distance, and the harbour was literally over the road, so you could walk to some fab fish restaurants in the evenings. A truly great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: markde
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with a great location for a decent price in an expensive hotel city. $200 a night, compared with the $450 that the Marriott across the road wanted. We had an eighth-floor internal room for a night in July and were really impressed. The room was smallish (though with a huge bathroom) and had been recently modernized. A big LCD TV at the end of the bed, with a Sherwood receiver and Sony DVD/VCR for listening to music or watching movies through the speakers installed in the walls. The internal room is cheaper, and I actually would recommend it (less noisy). Though don't look over the atrium balcony if you have a fear of heights. It's straight down 8 floors to the lobby. Location: The Aquarium T stop is literally right outside the door, and you're right by the Faneuil Hall marketplace. And it's just a two-minute walk to the ferry to Provincetown, etc. We stayed here the night before getting on the ferry, and the hotel let us store our bags here when we got back a week later, while waiting for our flight out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: pmatts19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Harborside Inn July 3rd and 4th. We were in room 805 Cityview. The room was very clean and the maid service was excellent. I would recommend a cityview room on a high floor. It was a bit noisy at night but with the windows closed and the air on and being exhausted from the daytime activities we slept like babies. However, at one point on the night of the 4th, there was VERY loud music, I could not locate where it was coming from in order to alert the front desk, then at last it stopped. Being on the highest floor was fun, we could see everything when we stuck our heads out the window. The front desk staff were very kind. We received 2 KEYS upon check in which we found odd but they worked unlike sometimes those cardkeys don't always work especially if you forget and put them next to your cell phone. The gal at the front desk even popped our microwave popcorn for us one night. Parking was a three block hike. We dropped our luggage, I stayed with it and checked in while my husband parked the car. He stated it was a short enjoyable walk back. We did feel however, that it was pretty expensive even with the hotel discount. Free wireless internet was wonderful. The elevators were pretty quick for such an old building. The ice and vending machines were in the basement. That was probably the only negative thing we experienced. When visiting Boston in the future we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JudyMetroNYCarea
Reviews.Content: I usually check TripAdvisor before I book a hotel, but I found the Harborside Inn website somehow and booked directly with the hotel. I would say that we got lucky on this one. If I had read the reviews I might not have stayed there. Our primary goal was the location. We planned on spending little or no time at the hotel. So the lack of ammenities or the hotel staff's lack of attention (as others stated) didn't bother us. They were fine with us. We didn't ask alot of questions and didn't expect anything either. We did have to ask for a second key though. We were handed only 1upon check-in. I haven't carried a key on a plastic key chain in years from a hotel! I thought all had switched to the key cards by now. The hotel's website does not show wood floors with exposed brick walls so we did not expect that either. It looked modern and clean, which it was. We were surprised however that after the first night they only made the bed and did not change the towels. The following day, my husband found one of the maids and asked her to put fresh towels in our room. She hung them on our door about 5 minutes later while we were still in the room. He had to find her again and tell her it was ok for HER to change the towels and make the bed. The $8 tip we left probably helped get the bed made the next night as well, but no extra towels. Other than that and than fact that one elevator was out of service, the hotel was fine. We had room #509, which I would recommend to anyone staying there. It was an interior room (king bed) but quiet. We heard some very faint music but not as bad as the other reviews. There were a couple of other rooms on the floor that were right near serious creaking problems in the hallways (possibly rooms #514 & #515) and I would avoid them. One thing about our room: it looked a little unfinished. Nothing on the walls, very plain. The sound system looked like it was put on the shelf as an after thought. And if you want to use the sound system, you'll need to bring CD's since there is virtually no reception in the room for AM/FM channels. The only thing the hotel might want to consider is updating the parking information. The garage at 75 State Street is closed for renovations, so the garage that the hotel is currently using is quite a walk if you have luggage. The parking situation might be the only reason we don't stay there again. It's makes a big difference and it's not convenient at all. Also, it might not be a good idea to stay there when the kids are back in college. We were there in July so the college hords were not at the two bars in front of the hotel. Otherwise, the hotel was clean, the staff was fine and the location was great. And as other reviewers stated, if you want 5-star service, you'll need to look elsewhere. There is no valet, no room service and no bellman, so if you expect these services, this is not the right place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Gretch3
Reviews.Content: We arrived very late1:00am and didn't have our bearings, got lost driving in from the airport but the front desk manager was very nice and helpful. Room was clean, modern, very cosy---small, but the noise from the cars outside was a problem. You couldn't hope to "sleep in". the location we discovered the next day was great! Close to the harbor, and a close walk to most interesting sights. Would probably ask for an inside room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Illinoisgal07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a 4 night stay at the Harborside Inn. the location was perfect. This was our first visit to Boston, and the hotel is located near everything we wanted to see. The people at the front desk were very helpful, telling us the way to go, and what T stop to take. The room was very clean and comfortable. In fact, this was the best hotel bed I have ever slept on. The pillows were wonderful! I loved the 2 brick walls, wished we would have had hardwood floors in our room. The room was 612, near the back of the building, so we had a street view, but it was quiet. I strongly suggest staying here. It didn't have a bar or restaurant, but there are many close by. Lucia's in the North End was great, so was Legal Sea Food around the corner. The Black Rose across the street was comfortable, and a block from Quincy Market. I would stay here again. Thank you for a great visit to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Best rate but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ab3273
Reviews.Content: Well when other hotels are charging 400 a night, 179 seems great. And for a one night business stay it's fine. But dont let them give you the lousy rooms on the elevator shaft. No window except looking into the shaft. no amenities, but perfectly functional if all you want is a room in a great location. Think 5 story immigrant walk up meets an elevator and you got it.

Reviews.Title: “Well-priced, nicely designed room decor”
Reviews.Author: miminli
Reviews.Content: Harborside Inn was a great, affordable hotel in a convenient location. The only thing I missed was a swimming pool - particularly because temperature were well into the high 90s the weekend we stayed in Boston. The room was well designed with a modern, simple decor. The bathroom had a huge, slate wall-in shower which was a real treat as I rarely take a bath while at a hotel. The vanity was also constructed of slate tiles with a modern faucet; overall the bathroom was very urban chic. The stereo system is wired into the bathroom - a very nice touch! We had an outside, city-view room on the fourth floor and were able to hear a little bit of noise from a night club outside. But we only noticed it the first night. I would definitely consider staying here again, especially if I am on a budget and don't want to splurge for an over-priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Comnfortable Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paulie47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harborside over Memorial Day Weekend. Our room was a smallish city-view room with a queen size bed that was very comfortable. The walls were exposed brick, and we had two pretty large windows overlooking the back side of the hotel (on a street, not an alley). The room was well furnished and attractive. The room was clean, and while not large had enough storage space for our stuff. It was a great base for exploration of central Boston on foot, right near the acquarium (and at the acquarium stop on the T.) The best thing was the price which was much lower than that for other nearby hotels. This is not a full service hotel. There is no room service. I don't grade down for that because you know that going in. You don't have gyms, or swimming pools. There is wi-fi free to guests in all the rooms, and two computers for guest use downstairs. There is no parking. If you have a car, they have a deal with a parking lot a block and one half away. It might be wise to drop off your luggage, then park your car. There is no bellboy service. I do mark it down a little for not having any sort of continental breakfast. There really are no breakfast spots in the neighborhood open on weekends (this is largely a financial district) other than at the Long Wharf Marriot a block away and that is expensive. I found the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful, especially with restaurant recommendations -- they knew the best places, and because the hotel doesn't have its own, they didn't feel pressured to recommend eating in-house. I highly recommend this place unless you want to spend 3x the price for bell service and a coffee shop for breakfast. Even if you eat at the Marriott you will save several hundred dollars per night staying at the Harborside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for the Boston Tourist”
Reviews.Author: TravelRevue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harborside for two nights on a recent visit to Boston. Iâ€™ve been to Boston before on business trips, but this was my first visit as a tourist. The hotelâ€™s location makes it a great choice for exploring the city as itâ€™s centrally located to a number of Boston landmarks/neighborhoods. I felt the price we paid was very fair for a city center hotel during the week. Itâ€™s not a luxurious, or even full- service, property, but it met my needs. Rooms were okay. We had a Cityview room with a king bed. Really liked the hardwood floors and exposed brick walls in the room. Bedding was comfortable if a bit soft. Bathrooms needed some work. Limited counter space, cracked porcelain on the sink, fixtures were a bit worn and dated. Nothing outlandish, but everything just needs to be redone in the bathrooms. TV was okay, with a good channel selection. Small love seat and large table filled out the room. Front desk was very nice at check-in but other than that, pretty limited service/staff interaction. No room service or bar/restaurant. No bell desk or porter. Checking luggage was self-service. We went out late one night for some drinks and right outside the main door on State Street was a young man stumbling from the bar next door throwing up. The vomit stayed there, uncleaned, outside the front door for the next day and a half. Location is what really attracted us to this hotel. Minutes to Faneuil Hall, Waterfront and the North End. Short walks to the Financial District, Boston Garden, Boston Common, Beacon Hill, etc. There is a T stop right outside the front door as well. Plenty of bars /restaurants within minutes of the hotel. Really got to see a lot of Boston and this was a great home base. Overall, I would recommend the Harborside for anyone looking for a good, clean, well-priced, well-located property to explore Boston. However, if youâ€™re looking for plush rooms or a little extra service, you might want to consider other options.

Reviews.Title: “WIll definately recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: RafikiLondon
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, the location and the staff were really very helpful. Within walking distance of Little Italy, Chinatown, the market and the business district. A no-fuss place. Note that the webside does say it has no - or few external windows. But it is so well designed that this is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Harborside”
Reviews.Author: rjkcpktrips
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's third trip to Boston. We had previously stayed in another hotel the first two times but due to ownership changes (significantly higher rates) we looked for another hotel and found the Harborside Inn. I booked this hotel in about five months earlier and got an atrium room for 149.00 per night. I was able to check in early (11 am) which was a definate bonus. The room was recently renovated with a king sized bed and a flat screen television. The room was very clean and nice. The only negative was the room did not have any pictures and kind of lacked some character. The location was GREAT! The blue line aquarium stop is literally outside the hotel. Close to North End which is Little italy. We had dinner at L'Osterio which was fantastic. Very reasonable and super food. A block or two away from Qunicy Market/Fanueil Hall as well. We had Celtics tickets and we had less than a 10 minute walk to TD Banknorth Garden. If you like to go to a bar or two, I would highly recommend the Tap and Sullivans Tap. The Tap is close to Quincy Market and we had a bartender whom was SUPER friendly and offering us popcorn made in Quincy Market. Sullivans Tap has always been one of our favorite stops. The Sam Adams tour is also worthwhile. We were told to visit Doyle's which is very nice but off of the beaten path. We were told we could walk, but it looked like a shakey neighborhood so that was where the 1-day pass came in handy. If we go back to Boston, I would probably look elsewhere first, but would be willing to stay here again. It was a very nice hotel but kinda lacked that little bit of character to put it over the top. The front desk was VERY helpful during the checkout and getting us a cab to the airport (we had a 7am flight and the T was still shut down).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Harborside!”
Reviews.Author: nitalp429
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Harborside Inn and it was a very great experience! We loved the room, we had the exposed brick wall, and a view of the cityside...the Aquarium T stop was literally outside the hotel (10 steps away), which was really convenient! The hotel was cozy, and quiet...although there was some street construction in the morning. The room was clean, had all the basics, and felt like a home, not a hotel! We would absolutely stay here again! My only warning is not to park in one of the parking garages--you will at least get charged $30 for 2 hours parking, and $33/day if you leave your car after 5AM :( It is worth the time to look for street parking!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience, The Worst I Have Ever Had At A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolynTLC
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN TO. I can't even say that it is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at, because we ended up leaving and staying somewhere else! When we arrived, there was a sign outside the front desk saying "manager will return momentarily". After 40 minutes of waiting, literally, a man finally arrives and starts yelling at us for being impatient! We ask what has taken so long and why we had to wait 40 minutes to be helped and he starts cursing at us and telling us we had to leave. When we asked for our money back, he called the cops on us!!!! I have never in my life been treated in such an unprofessional and horrific way. Whatever you do, do NOT stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: al675
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Harborside Inn for one night, and I couldn't have been happier. Everyone I interacted w/ there was friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and comfortable. I stayed in a city view room with a queen-sized bed, and I could hardly believe how comfortable it was. I honestly can't remember the last time I slept so well. As for location, I really couldn't have asked for more. I'm from the area, so I know Boston pretty well, and there's nowhere i would rather stay in the city. The Aquarium train stop is literally steps from the hotel, so anything that isn't w/ in walking distance can be reached easily on the train. Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market are just a block or two away, so there are plenty of restaurants, shopping, and bars right around the corner. I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't always believe what you see”
Reviews.Author: hkychick971
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the hotel is in a perfect location to Quincy Market, the T station and other hot night spots as well. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The room rates are one of the best in the area without a doubt. There is free coffee and tea in the lobby and two computers and also WIFI in the lobby. HOWEVER....one of the things that truly appealed to me when booking the hotel room was the ambiance that I expected when looking at the picture of the hotel rooms. The exposed brick, the hardwood floors, the queen size sleigh beds....not your typical hotel room and I was really looking forward to that. NOT TO BE!!! None of the above are in the hotel. The hardwood floors have all been carpeted, the exposed brick walls have been covered up with drywall and sleigh bed?...uh, nowhere in sight. To me, that is blatant false adverstising since all of those things are still listed on the website as what you get in EACH room. The only other problem is that the hotel is sandwiched between two bars. While they didn't bother my husband and I too much, it might discourage some travelers who want to get a decent night's sleep to have the bar still going strong at 2am. I'm honestly not sure i would stay here again simply because I don't like being promised one thing and when you get there, you get nothing of what you were in fact promised.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Difficult_t0_please
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harborside Inn for 5 nights. We had booked an atrium room, which we stayed in for the first night. The room overlooked a skylit atrium but we could not keep the blinds open for light to flow into the room as passerby's would be able to look in as they waited for the lift. The next morning, we approached the front desk to inquire about an upgrade to a city view room. They upgraded us with no extra charge to a newly renovated city view room and this was a lovely room. The windows opened out into State Street and light flowed in. The room was large, with a flat screen TV, DVD player, stereo, strong shower, queen bed. Extremely comfortable. We had just come from New York city where we had stayed at the Westin Times Square and I can safely say that the city view room at the Harborside Inn was comparable to a 5 star hotel in New York city! The staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay and made us feel completely at home. It did not have the clinical feel of 5 star hotels. There is free wireless internet access (which was a little temperamental) and two computers in the lobby available for free internet access. In the comfortable lounge, there is also complimentary coffee, tea and hot chocolate, which was most welcomed after coming in from the cold. The location of the Hotel is superb with Faneuil Market next door, the T station (Aquarium) in front of the hotel, a short walk to Long Wharf and the North End within walking distance to some wonderful Italian restaurants. i would definitely return to his hotel on my next visit to Boston (only in a city view room!) and would recommend it to anyone thinking of spending some time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Everything promised”
Reviews.Author: TinPshr
Reviews.Content: The Harborside Inn is NOT a full service hotel. There's no restaurant and limited services. But what it offers is great, modern rooms with flat screen TVs, a stereo system wired throughout and huge full length mirrors. The location is perfect, being located at the edge of Faneuil Hall. It's a quick and easy cab ride to the theater district. The value factor is through the roof!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Leelee-TA
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Harborside Inn was better than I expected. We stayed in the atrium room without the exposed brick walls. It was still great . The design and colors were trendy...beige, dark woods, beautiful mirror and slated tiled bathroom which was very roomy. It was not that bright but the recessed lighting and bedside lights made the room feel comfortable and relaxing. The room size was adequate. It had one queen size bed with a table and two chairs which was enough room for me and my husband. The bed was very comfortable. The flat screen TV did not work (no cable) so they switched our room to an identical room two floors down without any problem. The location was great. The hotel is next to Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market, the Aquarium and is walking distance to the North End.The subway stop (the blue line) is right in front of the hotel. There is free coffee and newspapers in the lobby. This hotel was a great deal. We saved over a hundred dollars by staying here compared to other hotels in the area. We will definitely go back to the Harborside Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Collegegirl1
Reviews.Content: We wanted to a stay in Boston to celebrate my mother's 80th birthday. While visiting Boston earlier in the year my mother saw this hotel and mentioned she would love to stay there at sometime. My sisters and I booked two rooms and we all met in Boston for a night. The location is great, we were steps from Faneuil Hall, and the North End! The hotel is just finishing up a complete renovation as other reviewers have mentioned. The two rooms we had were very nice. The beds were comfortable (great mattress) with lots of pillows ( that is important to me). The shower was great, and I loved the tile in the bathroom. Each room had a flat screen TV and a great stereo system. Both rooms were atrium rooms that had windows that looked on to the center of the hotel. I really enjoyed my stay, and I'm planning on coming back again in the spring with my husband

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Berta26
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a romantic city break before Christmas. Initially we selected the hotel as it was in a good area and was very reasonably priced. However, it was even better than we imagined. The hotel is a short stroll from the famous Faneuil Hall and Quincy Market. Also, the T stops right outside the hotel, making it great for getting around the city and also to and from the airport. We booked an atrium room, which although wasn't huge, it was still fantastic. The wall mounted flat screen tv, dvd/video/cd player which could be adjusted to play in the bathroom was great!! The bathroom was spacious and clean, with a fantastic shower. As mentioned by another reviewer on this site, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have EVER slept on!!!! If we return to Boston again, we will not hesitate to reserve a room here. Have already recommended it to family and friends for their upcoming holidays this year.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe my ears”
Reviews.Author: jacklynl29
Reviews.Content: Let me start out with the positives. The hotel is nice, great location, free internet access & coffee in the main lobby, room was clean and modern, but bare. More like a one night stay kind of place, which was exactly what it was for us. It wasn't till we were asleep that we realized how thin the walls actually were. In the middle of the night a women was being beaten by a man somewhere in the hotel and the whole fight echoed throughout the hotel. My fiance and I were horrified! It lasted for about half an hour to forty five minutes before we called the front desk and they informed us the cops had already been called and were on there way. The cops came in about 10 minutes and silence returned. However after hearing such a horrible event sleep did not come easily. I'm certain it was a rare situation but I don't know if I would ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: getawayplans
Reviews.Content: We overall had a good experience. The room we had was newly renovated, so really clean and modern, but it did not have brick walls or hardwood floors :( We opted for a city view room and I would recommend paying the extra $ for it ... the atrium rooms looked on to the centre of the hotel (elevators) I would not have been comfortable and having a window that can open is nice. Nice flat screen TV, DVD player and good stereo (with speakers in the washroom) Agree with the other comments on the noise levels, the night we didn't go out we were awoken at 2:00am with hoots and hollering, doors opening and closing (I think they could relieve this maybe by putting some weather stripping around the doors or a better closer - it's loud) The front desk served its purpose but didn't find them overly helpful (there was a help wanted sign in the window) The best part of the hotel is the Location, you can't beat it ... it took us less then 10min. from the Airport (incl. shuttle) and subway stop is right outside the door (so you can get pretty much anywhere in the city), Quincy Markey is also right at its door step, we could see the Aquarium from our room too. We had great plans to tour the city but didn't really get out of the neighbourhood. Next visit to Boston we will probably stay in a different part since we explored this area already.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: Lowrider99
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to stay at a hotel that was more personal then the large chain ones. We found Harborside Inn on the internet. The room was not at all like what was on their web site. The web has pictures of hardwood floors and brick wall in the room we slelected. Upon arrival we found out the Inn was still under construction and the room was not at all what we see on line. The location of the Inn is perfect. The employees were very nice and helpful. The room was very clean but had very poor lighting. The price was fair. We would stay there again but this time we will have a more detailed talk the the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl89
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Boston, we wanted to have a location that was convenient and not too expensive. We selected the Harborside Inn located near Fanieul Hall. It looked like a great location and the price was very reasonable -- we paid about $159 per night (plus tax). First, I should mention that the location is excellent. 2 minute walk to Faniuel Hall/Quincey Market, Boston Aquarium nearby (which we didn't visit), subway stop (The "T") literally right outside of the hotel (Aquarium stop) and a convenience store at the corner. Many sights were easily a 15 minute walk and anything further, we just hopped on the T. It was great. The Harborside Inn offers 24 hour complimentary coffee & tea. They have 2 computers in their lobby with internet access hooked up to a printer and this was compimentary to hotel guests -- we found this very useful. The staff was extremely pleasant. On the flipside, it's just an average hotel. The rooms were clean but small. The exposed brick and hardwood floors gave it a nice feel but they only had cheap miniblinds on the windows with no curtains. Although our room faced other rooms, I felt uncomfortable without curtains, that maybe people could see in. Also, although it was not a big deal, I noticed that the wall was partially unpainted and the bathroom & room door were not painted well (you could see white through the one coat of paint they put on). I know those are little things and honestly, not that important to me anyway (we were not in the room much) but the guest rooms have potential to be really nice and those things just made it seem a little sloppy. They were obviously remodeling becuase there was some work being done around the hotel so maybe they haven't gotten to the guest rooms yet. Important note: There is no restaurant or room service at the hotel. This wasn't an issue for us since there is a convenince store nearby and also Quincey Market is very close and walkable for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Lastly, I think I read this in a review for this hotel before but I completely forgot about it until we arrived and it's really important. If you decide to stay at this hotel, be sure to ask for a quiet room on the upper floors in the back of the hotel. This is really important becuase there is a nightclub right next door. The first night, we did hear some music but we were so exhausted that I fell asleep anyway. I would stay at this hotel again -- the price was right, rooms were clean, staff friendly and the location excellent. If you prefer a full service Marriott type hotel, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Scooby3482
Reviews.Content: Right from check-in, I knew this would be a great stay at a great hotel! The front desk clerk was extremely kind, funny, and very knowledgeable. Just from being in the lobby for a few minutes and seeing the interaction of the staff with the guests, they seem to do anything and everything to help you if you need it! They were out of the room I had booked (city view) but upgraded us to a room with a bigger bed in it (not a problem for us at all!!) It was definitely newly renovated.. and it was absolutely GORGEOUS! We couldn't believe how nice it was, the bed was wicked comfortable, the tv was amazing.. overall, it was just a great experience.. I cannot wait to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Harborside Inn-Great Value”
Reviews.Author: clohan
Reviews.Content: My business colleague and I stayed at the Harborside Inn in early November. From Check-in until Check-out everything exceeded out expectations. The desk staff was very knowledgeable about the area and very helpful. The location couldn't have been better....close to fanieul? hall, the aquarium/waterfront, and also just steps away from the North End. The room was very clean and the mattresses are the most comfortable I've ever slept on. Harborside Inn is the place to stay when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: OtisDads
Reviews.Content: The hotel's rooms look like they were recently renovated, with flat panel television, sleek modern bathroom, and lights with dimmers. The lobby seems like it missed the renovation, but maybe that's coming soon. We loved walking right to Faneuil Hall, the Common, and (most importantly) the great Italian food in the North End. The Big Dig served this hotel well (the raised freeway was once within spitting distance of the front door), and it's right above the Aquarium T stop, just a couple stops directly from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Handy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chucky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in October 2007, we had an atrium room and all was fine. The hotel is situated in a good location which is handy for most attractions in downtown Boston. The room was comfortable and clean, staff on the front desk were very helpful, internet access in the lobby was a useful resource as was the coffee that was availble 24hrs a day. overall tthe stay was a good experience and would recommend this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Maui4meFlorida
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for the weekend of 11/2. The location is absolutely perfect. Rooms were recently remodeled and look nothing like the photos on the site. They look more South Beach. They are very nicely appointed, with king beds, flat screen tv and stereo system. We had interior rooms on the 4th floor. Saturday morning we heard jackhammers for a few minutes, but otherwise the rooms were very quiet. The toilet in my room wasn't properly anchored and leaked slowly onto the floor. We reported it several times but it was never addressed. I presume it was a leftover item from the remodel. We simply placed extra towels on the floor and it wasn't a big deal. The other couples had no issues with their rooms and all were very pleased. Other than the hotel seeming slightly understaffed, I see no reason for the poor reviews I read prior to my visit. As a Marriott Platinum member, I tend to be expect a decent level of accomodations. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service were great!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyRodriguez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights here last week and were pleasantly surprised after reading all the reviews here. I will admit that there is some street noise if you have a city view room but we really enjoyed being able to open the windows and sit and look out at the city so it was ok for us. The hotel is a little mix matched in their decor and the lobby needs updating but all in all it was good. Although I was looking forward to staying in the older rooms, we checked in early and got one of the newly renovated rooms. As someone said earlier, everything was new and freshly done. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large (which I really liked). The HD TV and sound system were my husband's favorite part of the stay, they even have a speaker in the bathroom! The 24hr computer access was really helpful and I can't say enough good things about the staff, especially Robert and Anthony, who went out of their way to assist us with every request! The location is really within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions and if not the T is right outside the door. We even rode the T to the airport @ 5:30 am and it was so much easier than getting a cab. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and if I'm ever in Boston again, I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished but Unfinished”
Reviews.Author: mhf_wanderer
Reviews.Content: The Harborside Inn was overall an odd hotel in a good location. The Aquarium stop on the Blue Line is literally directly outside the entrance to the hotel. It is also a short walk from Fanueil Hall and other tourist sites. The rooms are (very) recently refurbished and everything has an overall new, unused feel and smell to it. The bath and bed linens were clean and fresh, and the new carpet springy and soothing under the feet. The in-room thermostat seemed to work quite well also. My newly tiled and outfitted bathroom was so new the tiles still had masonâ€™s dust on them. This is where the pros end, as there were a number of things wrong with the Harborside. For one, the rooms are quite austere: no writing desk, no hotel literature (not even the State-required emergency exit routes or rate information on the door), the fan in the bathroom didnâ€™t work (in spite of a separate switch), there was spotty hot water, no stopper for the sink and, in spite of extensive shelving, no extra blankets, pillows, or laundry bags. Maidsâ€™ carts, and dirty linens were abandoned throughout the hallways for my whole 24-hour stay. My room had strangely inappropriate stereo components more suitable for a bachelor pad than a hotel room (huge flat screen TV, VHS/DVD player, etc.) The promised free WiFi was very flaky and quite inadequate â€“ and no Ethernet LAN connections were offered in the room. Finally, the entire hotel appears to either be in the midst of remodeling or has just remodeled. My freshly cut key didnâ€™t work in the door and I needed to try two more keys until one worked. For $230 it seemed a bit over priced compared to other choices in town. I give it two stars.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CubbieFan23
Reviews.Content: This hotel may not have the amenities that a large hotel chain would have but it is comfortable & convenient. The rooms are very simple but the bed was very comfortable and the decor is pleasant. The street noise can be loud on weekends but we slept with a fan on (found in the closet ) and could not hear a thing. The hotel staff was very friendly, down-to-earth and extremely helpful. The location cannot be beat. There is so much within walking distance. You can walk to Faneuil Hall, Quincy Market, the New England Aquarium, the beginning stop of the Old Town Trolley (which is also the start of the Ghosts & Graveyards tour), and you are steps away from the Freedom trail as well as a few blocks from the North End, Paul Revere's home and the Boston Common. The location is amazing. If you do need to take a cab somewhere, they are easy to flag down right in front of the hotel. During our visit we also stayed at one of the high end hotels on the waterfront because it was connected to the conference we were attending in Boston. Contrary to what other reviews may say, not all locations are close to sights in Boston. We had absolutely nothing around us by the waterfront. The area we were in was like a concrete jungle; no greenery, no historic sights, no fun. Though we had more amenities in our hotel (like a flat screen TV) we missed the location of the Harborside Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Massingberd
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Boston and we stayed at the Harborside for 3 nights and really enjoyed it. The location is really good, central, with easy access to the main attractions. We stayed 2 nights in a city view room which was small but definitely big enough for 2 people. The bed was comfortable and the room had real character, I particularly liked the exposed brickwork. The bathroom was a bit of a let down- it had everything you need but I felt it was in need of modernisation. We returned to the Harborside for our last night in Boston after travelling around and stayed in an atrium view room. The room had clearly recently been decorated, the bathroom was excellent and the room was huge as was the bed and TV. We actually paid less for this room which we couldnâ€™t really understand as, although it had less character than the city view room, we felt it was of higher standard. Boston is an expensive city for accommodation but for the money I think the Harborside is a great choice. We stayed at the Radisson on our first night and although that had a great room and probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, it lacked character and was expensive. The Harborside is more cost effective and has a welcoming ambience and is far from a faceless hotel that's part of a big chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: terrisshaw
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this hotel. What a location. Just steps away from Quincy Market, the "T", the Wharf, the North End and the Freedom Trail. The room was very clean, bed extremely confortable, bathroom on the small side. Front desk people very helpful and polite, two computers in lobby available to use, coffee in lobby 24 hrs, We had an inside room so no street noise. There is construction going on to update rooms. We were out all day sightseeing so that did not interfere with our comfort. We had an early morning departure, they had a cab waiting for us (it was raining). For the price, location you cannot beat the Harborside Inn. I would recommend this hotel to my family & friends. Also lots of places to eat close by.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay All The Way Around”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler777777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel and was kept awake until 3:00 in the morning by the bars which come to life at night! You could hear the partiers as if they were in the next room. I complained to the hotel clerk and he said there was nothing he could do about it. The next morning I was complaining to the manager (who was very confrontational and unprofessional) stating that I wanted another room and the manager claimed she had never heard that complaint before this one. A lady sitting in the lobby stormed over to the desk and said that is so not true since she had just complained the day before when she complained about the same thing and had been placed in a different room. I also checked with others in my group (we had 3 rooms total) and all said the same thing - they were kept up until after 3:00 a.m. because of the booming of the bars and then the people leaving the bars. I was told by one of the clerks that the owner decides if anyone gets credit based on how he is feeling the day he looks at the complaint. Very unprofessional group - there are a lot better Boston hotels without the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough!!”
Reviews.Author: MrAndMrsM2007
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the excellent customer service set this place apart. Steve was extremely helpful during check-in, gave great directions, and was extremely pleasant. I'm not sure of the names of the others who worked the desk, but everyone made our stay enjoyable. You can't beat the location of this hotel! Literally steps away from Quincy Market and Long Wharf, with the subway "T" stop in front of the building. (There is absolutely no reason to have a car in Boston. Everything is within walking distance or a short ride on the T. We returned our car immediately after checking in). The hotel is a converted mercantile building and is just charming with the exposed brick walls and hardwood floors. It is worth paying a little extra for the city view. Other reviews have noted the street noise, but we stayed on the 8th floor and the street noise was no problem. (We heard city trash trucks idling in the middle of the night, but no bar-hoppers or anything like that). The hotel was under construction during our stay, but a quick call to the front desk a week or so before our stay ensured that we were as far from the construction "noise" as possible. In fact, the only way we knew the hotel was under construction was the unfinished lobby. We appreciated the coffee and computers in the lobby; they made checking in to our flight online a breeze. Some negatives: No coffee maker or safe in the room. Bathrooms are clean but not updated. Ice machine was in the basement. Hotel under construction.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this place.”
Reviews.Author: fpencollector
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Definitely an alternative to the chains. No food on site though but there is a sports bar and convenience store immediately adjacent with bars and restaurants within a block or two. Fanuiel Hall is just a block away. And the T stop is right outside their front door. I would stay there again. I loved the brick walls and the hardwood floors.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Marie25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March and had a wonderful time.Our room was lovely and clean,staff very friendly and the owner Mark was really nice.I manage a Inn on Marthas Vineyard and would really recommend The Harbourside Inn to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: twolancastrians
Reviews.Content: 13/06/2007 A tripadvisor Cheshire UK Just spent 3 days at the Harbourside to meet our US based relatives. The hotel lobby still needs some work but our rooms were very comfortable and the hotel is in an excellent location, yards from the harbour and Quincy market. Hot drinks are available in the lobby but not breakfast but there are several options from small cafes to the adjacent Marriot. Exellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Good value”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: Our atrium view room was larger than expected and included a small table with two hard wooden chairs. A more comfortable chair would have been appreciated. Room was generally very quiet with occasional noise from guests walking in room above. During the day, there was a little construction noise from other parts of the hotel, but it did not bother us. The large comfortable lobby provided free internet access. Complimentary coffee and tea were available 24 hours. We paid $169 plus tax per night. Other, more upscale hotels in the area are $300-400. The Harborside is very close to Quincy Market, and Faneuil Hall. The Aquarium "T" stop is just outside the front door. Boston Common is about a mile away. Many moderately priced eating places are near by at Quincy Market and neighborhood cafes. My only complaint regards placing the towel rack directly above the toilet. Small towels went for a swim on more than one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Harborside Inn”
Reviews.Author: Snoberon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay, the location is perfect if you are coming from the airport, subway station located in front of the hotel. Nice large lobby, 2 computers which are available to guests along with coffee in the lobby. We had a room over looking the street, the exposed brick walls and the sleigh style bed along with the wood floors gives the room a nice warm feel to it. Now with the location of the hotel being close to several bars in the area, it can get loud late at night, so if you are the type to goto bed early, I suggest that you don't get a city-view room, and ask for a room on the higher floors. Friendly staff. I will be staying here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Robert...he is a gem”
Reviews.Author: LondonHarrypotter
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in the Harborside Inn. Hotel has a great location and I really loved the relaxed informal atmosphere. Don't expect luxury as you wont get it but look deeper and you will see charm and character. Robert, one of the Front Desk Clerks, is a very friendly guy with a great personality and great customer care skills. A real asset to this hotel. I would certainly return. And, in response to one of the reviews regarding lack of telephone directories in the room...I found mine in the top of the wardrobe and the telephone instructions in one of the drawers! Another asset is the free internet facility in the lobby, including printer.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: jwd1113
Reviews.Content: Nice, small (but expanding) property a block from Quincy Market. Not a luxury hotel by any means; there are few amenities. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Responsive and helpful staff. With a subway stop just a few yards from the hotel door, access from Logan Airport couldn't be easier.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: DaggersCarnforthUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harborside Inn during Sept 2005, it is in the perfect location being on the T line from the airport. Most tourist attractions are within walking distance and very close to Quincy Market , shops and restaurants. Incredible value for money. We are going again in June 2007 and we NEVER go back to a bad hotel. I like the fact that the Management are responding to reviews and it is good to hear the hotel is being refurbished. Looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “location yay, parking Nay”
Reviews.Author: Leister
Reviews.Content: As a previous review mentioned, location - this hotel is located a few steps from Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market which makes it convenient to do a lot of walking. Parking, however is at a STEEP price. The hotel does not have any on site parking but does offer directions to the 75 State Steet Garage up the street. We parked there for 2 hrs (+2 mins) before deciding to go out. Big mistake. While I travel quite a bit for business, I am aware that parking can cost a bit, I certainly was not prepared for $35! Anything over 2 hrs is the daily rate of $35. (not posted anywhere) When I inquired about the rate at the front desk, I was told, well if you got your ticket stamped, you would've received a discount...maybe 20% (?!) Uh, maybe you should've told me that BEFORE I tried to leave the garage. Renovations in this hotel are as previously stated - loud, dusty and not noted when the reservation was made. Had I known of this I would have selected another hotel. Doors were slamming all night. Not sure why. The room was clean, bathroom clean but in need of a refresh and a bit more water pressure would have been nice. No Yellow Pages phone book in the room and no directions on the use of the phone. After the parking fiasco, I sure as heck was not even going to touch the phone. On the plus side - they do have internet access in the lobby to use and they offer complimentary coffee/tea/cocoa. If you just want a place to stay for the night, this hotel is fine. Longer than one night, there are other places available.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Quincy market and comfortable romm”
Reviews.Author: darkrider
Reviews.Content: Very close to Quincy market. Right in front of the Aquarium subway station (blue line). Helpful staff except one guy at the front desk who refused to call us a taxi when we checked out saying we could find one by ourselves in the street (we had big luggage !). Comfortable room. A bit noisy sometimes because of renovation being done at the time we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “A great room”
Reviews.Author: specialhat
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone and had an atrium room at the Harborside Inn and stayed for three nights. It's in a great location - just minutes away from the Quincy Market - which meant it didn't really matter that there were no food facilities in the hotel as you could buy all sorts of food close by. The room itself was great - large and with a very comfy bed. While they left out a magazine about the city, that was as far as the hotel literature went, and I would have liked to have been given some more info about the hotel and the surroundings as you usually get when staying somewhere. One day I didn't leave the room until lunchtime and was delighted that the room was made up by the housekeeper in the afternoon (I expected they would just leave it at that time). The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and there is free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, and very good value”
Reviews.Author: MabGlyndwr
Reviews.Content: Having seen the sample photos on the website, I was expecting great things, and I wasn't disappointed. The place isn't 5 star (and doesn't claim to be!), but it looked clean, comfortable and in a great location. The Harborside lived up to my expectations, with friendly, helpful staff. The rooms were very homely, and the comfortable bed ensured I always had a good night's sleep. The bathroom was also more than adequate. The location was so good that I spent the whole week without needing a cab (except to and from the airport). All in all, I had excellent value for the money I spent, and I'd have no hesitation in staying in the Harborside again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Quincy Market area”
Reviews.Author: velevele
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in mid-Nov 2006. I chose the hotel partly based on the helpful reviews posted here; thanks to the reviewers for helping me make my choice! Positives: -- I had a huge room, beautifully decorated, with large bathroom. -- I chose a room facing the interior atrium to avoid street noise and was very happy with that decision, as the room was very quiet both nights. -- I requested and received early check-in, about 1 PM, without any problems whatsoever. -- Hotel staff were helpful and friendly. -- Service of the room was excellent; it was kept clean and serviced promptly each day. -- This is a great location, convenient to the Quincy Market area (just a minute or so of walking). It is a short walk from the water taxi stop on Long Wharf and sits almost on top of the Aquarium (Blue Line) T stop. Numerous restaurants are nearby. -- As a woman traveling alone, I felt safe walking around in the hotel neighborhood by myself at night. -- The bed was extremely comfortable, and the reading lights were good. -- There is a large, secured (locked) storage area for luggage, in case you need to arrive early or late. -- There is free internet in the lobby. Negatives: -- The Aquarium T stop was closed for part of my stay (not the hotel's fault, of course!), but the Government Center and State stops are only about a 5-minute walk away as well. However, if it is critical for you to have the T stop right there, I would advise checking the MTBA website to see if any closures of the Aquarium stop are planned during your stay. I was very pleased with this hotel and would happily stay here again. Thanks again to the earlier reviewers who helped me make the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected from their advertising”
Reviews.Author: NMF
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a weekend visit. to do some shopping. I travel quite a bit for pleasure and business. We were very disappointed with this hotel. It is in a good location, you can walk everywhere or take the T, but with that also comes the noise from VERY busy nightclubs on both sides of the hotel. Our room looked nothing like the photos on the internet, we had a cityview room. There were very small windows with a ledge that hadn't been painted in years all the paint was chipped off on the floor. The bathroom was dirty, walls dirty, sink cracked, tub old. The floors were not clean, we pulled out the so called sofabed (it is a chair) and the sheets were dirty with crumbs etc. I called downstairs to get some clean sheets, they just dumped them on the bed when we were out, didn't even make the bed or take the dirty bedding away. It was just a very beat up room from the broken blinds, dirty curtains and smelled like stale smoke. The photos on the internet showed large windows, nice large rooms and brick walls...ours looked NOTHING like the photos. Low ceilings, small, and very small windows. It was loud at night with the nightclubs untill about 2am. If you want to stay somewhere relaxing and quiet this is not the hotel. I love to go out and we had a good dinner and drinks a couple doors down, the crowd at the bars next door were loud and rowdy. I have stayed at hundreds of hotels all over the country and world, I will not return to this hotel even though it is a excellent location to see the city on foot! I will stay at the Marriott or another boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location Can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie_Day
Reviews.Content: Prime location surrounded by retail, restaurants and tourist attractions. Rooms are spacious and clean. Staff very friendly and attentive. We did some shopping and found this hotel to be about $100 less per night than the other hotels in the area. We look forward to returning because we learned that the hotel is under going a complete make over. The new owners are going modern with the decor which will be finished next spring. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sloanmalone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harborside Inn for two nights. The location is perfect for seeing Boston. The rooms were big, and I think they are all suites. That is what I had. I am sold on the hotel. I have stayed at some of the other major hotels in downtown Boston, and this is by far a great place to stay. The small, cozy atmosphere of the lobby is welcoming. Best of all, the customer service was Excellent. The manager was on duty most of our stay and his positive attitude made our trip. Traveling all over the country, it is hard to get good customer service, but he was one of the best. What else is there to say, it was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Absolutely loved it”
Reviews.Author: andy1881
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time searching for hotels in Boston and this one just scraped in under our budget however now I have stayed there I think I may have actually paid more. As soon as you walk in through the front door this hotel oozes character - literally 30 second walk from Quincy market so location also couldnt be better for the tourist. Front desk extremely friendly and efficient. This hotel has option of atrium or city view rooms and in hindsight I may have payed the additional for a city view for a little extra light however the atrium was fine for us. The whole hotel including our room was clean and tidy and everything we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON IN BOSTON”
Reviews.Author: IJC
Reviews.Content: People take the time to write negative reviews but seldom write positive ones. I knew when we got home I had to write one. I only hope after reading my review, and even other reviews, people will make the right decision and give this place a chance. I am not one to typically go out of my way to even write such a thing as this hotel testimonial; but I felt compelled enough to do so after the great experience we had there. I recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone; and I promise you, you will not be disappointed! Location: The heart of Boston is definitely beating here! I have never been to a city that takes its history so proudly and eloquently. It was very impressive! Quincy Market, or as the locals call it, Faneuil Hall (Took me all day to figure out that they are one in the same) is about 100 yards from the front step of the hotel. And the â€œTâ€� (subway) is also right outside. Donâ€™t get me wrong, at night it did feel like the wildside came out of some people, and with a bar/club to the left of the hotel, it did pick up and my thoughts were â€œOh great, we are never going to get to sleepâ€�. I even went to the front desk and asked if this was going to go on all night and he said we should be ok when we go to our room. Going up in the elevator I cringed at what I assumed was going to be a long night. I eat my words now; we had one of the best nights sleep in a long time. The Hotel: I had my husband (of two days) make our reservations, sight unseen, because the â€œprice and locationâ€� were right where we wanted to be. His pick was right on the money yet againâ€¦the first was having me as his new bride! Coming from a small town in the Midwest, and knowing everyone in town, I did not know what to expect in Boston. If I could have wrapped up Calvin and taken him home with me, I certainly would have! His true smile and charm every time we went to the front desk asking where and what to do in Boston, made us realize that we had made the right choice in hotels, even after reading some of the less positive reviews. We end our Honeymoon with a big hug from Calvin and knowing that Boston will aways be part of our lives... Courtney and Matt

Reviews.Title: “Sad times at the Harborside Inn”
Reviews.Author: meandma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had intended to spend a romantic weekend at the Harborside Inn in Boston recently. We had reason to have high expectations since a previous stay last June had been very pleasant. However, that experience was not repeated. We checked in, changed, and set out for a night on the town, returning to the hotel at about 1:15 a.m. The first surprize was that all of the bars in the neighborhood were overflowing with raucous, screaming college students. (This hadn't been the case at all in June.) The front step of the hotel was covered in vomit. We tried to enter the hotel to escape the very unpleasant street scene, but found the door to be locked. Just then we were approached by a young man who identified himself as the hotel night clerk who informed us that he had come outside to clean up the vomit but had forgotten his keys! We asked him what we should do - wait for him to get the door open, or go find another hotel. He replied "I really don't know what to tell you" and walked away. After standing outside for almost an hour weighing our options (we had no reservation anywhere else, and all our luggage was locked inside along with our car keys), we were finally let back into the hotel by another guest who had been awakened by the impromtu street party and come downstairs to investigate. The next morning we checked out, determined to find a different hotel and salvage the weekend. I told the desk clerk about our ordeal and asked what sort of compensation the hotel would provide. She pled ignorance of the whole affair, and took down all my contact information, saying that the hotel would be in touch. I waited a week. No calls, no emails, no apologies. Finally, I called the hotel and asked the manager why they hadn't contacted me and what sort of compensation they would provide. The best excuse he could come up with was that they had lost my contact information! (They had managed to bill me, however.) Eventually, he promised to provide a full refund and hung up. Still no apology. Someone needs to remind these folks that being in the 'hospitality business' occasionally requires genuine hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but be careful of the noise!!”
Reviews.Author: ctron1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just OK As everyone has noted noise is a big big problem. Although it is a downtown hotel beside lots of night clubs so be warned! The free internet allows virtually nothing through the filters, I needed to download some documents and could not get access. We picked the hotel because of the location, but the internet was a major deciding factor as well. The car park is very far from the hotel, about 5 mins walk, which with bags was tough. There is no place to stop and unload in the very busy street outside I liked the hotel itself. It was clear and very quaint in its own way. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful. I would recommend the hotel but be warned of the noise!!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, great location”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNH
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Haborside Inn Boston in the beginning of August. After booking the room I read some very negative reviews on TripAdvisor and considered cancelling the reservation. But then I thought, it's just one night, how bad can it be? I was pleasantly surprised. I was on the lookout for dirt, and it was clean. Bed was comfortable, the room was cute. It wasn't noisy at all. It wasn't a fabulous hotel, but it was absolutely fine. Nothing to complain about, and the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but ask for the right room!”
Reviews.Author: pkstrand
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is in a great location. You can park your car at the Harbor Garage and not use it again until you leave. Walk to Quincy Market, walk the Freedom Trail, walk to whale watch, ferries and the aquarium, or take the T anywhere else. The Aquarium T stop is right outside the front door. There's also a Dunkin Donuts and a 7-11 within a block either direction for coffee or anything you forgot to pack. We also found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated -- not upscale, more B&B than hotel. I would stay here again, but only if I was able to book and guarantee a particular room -- that would be any even numbered room, preferably on a higher floor. Although MA state law now requires that all hotel rooms are non-smoking, we were given a room that used to be smoking and absolutely reeked. We asked to be moved, and they moved us to an atrium room on the 2nd floor. Sounds good. Take a shower, go to bed around 11, juuust start to fall asleep....and the club next door starts up. I have never in my life heard music played at such a volume. The walls were vibrating. It was as if the DJ was inside my head.
