Lots of poster have menioned this problem with rooms facing State Street. But this was an atrium room that shared a wall with the club. Don't get this room (#225). The music didn't stop until after 2 am. Needless to say, we requested to be moved and complained to the manager the next day. He was very apologetic and moved us to a quiet room on the 6th floor, and comped our parking for the pain and suffering we'd endured. The parking is expensive! $30 per day for the Harbor Garage. Normally, the hotel charges you half that rate. Also, there were several mosquitos in our room -- I killed three in one night -- and a family of ants that only made an appearance when food was about. Other than the noise and the bugs, decent price, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend Harborside Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kvegas
Reviews.Content: We returned today from a 4 day stay at the Harborside Inn in the downtown area of Boston and had a very pleasant stay. Location, location, location says it all. It was close to everything! The T aquarium stop right across the street, Quincy market literally 1 block away , the waterfront , and wonderful restaurants in the North end area . Our room was an atrium room and it was clean and comfortable. I had no problem what so ever connecting with the high speed internet . The room was always cleaned when we got back from a long day of sight seeing and the temperature comfortable. In the lobby they have available coffee and hot water for tea. It was nice just to be able to go down to the lobby and go back to the room without going outside. The staff at the front desk was very knowledgable and were helpful! They even helped me fix a minor suitcase problem! For 2 gals touring Boston for the first time it was a great vacation. They have all the visitors pamphlets in the lobby to help you plan your day. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Consider other hotels”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Location to Quincy Market; shopping; good food; harbor pier -Wireless Internet access -Great location to Boston's T (Blue line) with only 2 stops away from the Airport -------------------------------------------------------------------------- Cons: -Air Conditioner barely worked (not even sure it was A/C); asked for someone to look at it...never notified that anything was checked and/or fixed -Lack of power outlets close to work space -Free Internet; however massive internet filtering except for web traffic (higher ports are blocked); sorry business travelers may have difficulty getting to Corporate network; Instant Messaging is blocked -Recommend NOT taking outside rooms...too much noise. Some genius decided that revving his Harley @ 2am was funny and necessary. Delivery truck backup signals, etc. -Customer service could have been a little better. -Insect problem in my room -Bed was hard as a stone tablet. This hotel desperately needs to update the bedding; furniture; decor... -Furniture, specifically a chair, was falling apart -Window coverings were old and falling apart -Windows were thin and had packing tape around the bottom rim...I can only assume as to what that is for!?!? -Regular turnkey locks!?!? Com'n that isn't very secure!!! Regular bolt lock for second lock? If you have valuables...consider looking elsewhere. -Cost was high considering what I got...it was inflated due to the business conference. I considered several options for places to stay in Boston however specifically the location and Internet access. I thought that would trump everything else...I was wrong. Look realistically at all your options and what is most important to you on a trip and decide based off of that...I should have chosen sleep!

Reviews.Title: “super location but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel,one block from the waterfront ,one block from Fanuli(sp?) hall and the T-stop was right outsid the door.The room was exatly as pictured online and we booked an atrium room based on reviews complaining about the noise in street facing rooms.We did not hear any noise,even on a Saturday night and we were there 6 nights.The room was clean and nicely decorated and a nice size.Now for the bad stuff. The bathtub drain did not work and therefore I had to shower and missed taking my bath. The bed was the worst bed I ever slept in,in hotel ! It sagged in the middle and we rolled toward each other.Since the room was so quiet we did not want to chance another room so we asked for more pillows and made them into a feather bed of sorts.The staff did not go out of their way to be friendly but hey,maybe thats part of life in the big city.I'd recommend the room we stayed in #436 but make sure they have put in a new bed!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy - Hairs in bathroom, bed, and all over carpet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never been compelled to leave a review for a hotel but just had to, in this case. We stayed for the nights of May 3rd and 4th of 2006, and expected a lovely, clean, and comfortable hotel, based on reviews. The outside of the hotel is beautiful, as is the lobby, but upon arrival to our room, we found several hairs on the shelf under the mirror in the bathroom, as well as the same colored hairs in our bed, and all over the carpet. It was so disgusting. I have never stayed in a hotel that was so filthy. My father's room wasn't much better...his carpet was also very dirty and covered in hairs/etc. Also, the A/C was not cooling the rooms properly and both rooms were warm throughout the night. The hotel staff were very friendly, though - no complaints about them - and the location couldn't have been better, close to the water/aquarium, loads of fabulous restaurants, and super shopping. Just don't stay at this hotel if you're at all squeamish about things like finding 'other people's hair' in your bed! I have never stayed in a filthier place!!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: nevadanancy
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, but room was noisy, hot, and in slight disrepair. I'd stay again if I had to, but would probably look elsewhere first.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: carolinecag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights as part of a USA winter holiday and I would really recommend it based purely on the location. I would agree with all of the previous reviews that the location is just spot on - especially for nightlife - pubs and restaurants are within easy walking distance. I had previously stayed at the Omni Parker and preferred the location of the Harborside. Due to previous reviews I faxed the hotel to request a quiet room and did not receive a reply. However on check in we were able to switch to an atrium room. This was fairly quiet, however, the atrium does have a strange echo effect so even a sneeze on the ground floor reverberated around. The room we were in also had very little natural light despite windows to the atrium. We didn't find the area particularly noisy and were disappointed not to see any Ho's (see previous review) but there seemed to be lots of "frat boys" around - students to us Brits! The decor was ok, but the coffee in the lobby was either cold or empty. Far better to go to Dunkin Donuts two blocks up.The subway is right outside the hotel, but you might struggle if you have heavy cases. On the whole we found the hotel to be excellent value for money with a great location. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights as part of a short break from the UK in June 2005. The hotel was excellant value for money and located in a great position for exploring Boston. Close to Quincy Market, Tram, Aquariam, T. We stayed in a standerd room which was large cleam and conmfortable at a reasonable price. The hotel staff were efficient and helpful throughout our stay. Would definately return

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pakmoi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Boston Harborside Inn for three nights in December 2005. If you are taking the "T" in from Logan International, you can't beat the convience! You just take the blue line from the airport and get off at the aquarium stop. As soon as you leave the "T" station, you are standing right outside the Harborside's door!! I had read in Trip Advisor that the rooms facing the street could be noisy because of the bar next door. Because of those reviews we booked a room in the atrium instead. It was very quiet and comfortable. The furniture are Early American reproductions, and combined with the original brick walls, gives a very unique, historical effect to the room. The only negative aspect about the room is the back of the bathroom door had a large hole in it, as if someone had slammed their fist into the door. However, there were notices in the hotel that they were remodeling and perhaps they hadn't gotten to replacing the door yet. The desk staff were not overly friendly, but were helpful if you asked direct questions. Quincy Market is only a few minutes walk away, and the hotel is also a very close walk to the court house and finacial area. For the price and convience, I heartily recommend the Boston Harborside Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the fabric of the building”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel at the start and finish of a 3 week New England tour. The location is superb, if a little noisy late at night but I guess that is what you get in a large city centre. Unfortunately our atrium room was rather run down and left us feeling we had not got good value for money despite the prime position. The staff on reception gave the distinct impression we were interrupting their "private" telphone calls whenever we passed through. No mention was made of the ongoing renovations and closed restaurant when we booked. Overall, a great position but let down by dilapidated structure and charmless staff.

Reviews.Title: “Harborside Inn- Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: The_Stig
Reviews.Content: My fianace and I booked a room at the Harborside Inn for the July 4th festivities in Boston. We had always wanted to go up there to see the town anyway and we thought that this was a great reason to do so. The rates for the hotel at this time were VERY reasonable considering how crowded the city was to see the festivities and whats better, the Inn had no 'minimum stay'- I hate it when they force you to stay x amount of nights. The hotel was pretty easy to get to, make sure you have good directions if you are driving, Boston is a labryinth and you can get turned around real easy. One thing is for sure, if you stay here GET THE PARKING SPOT. Otherwise parking is a chore that you are going to have to deal with. Park it, forget it and walk or take trains everywhere else. Visually the hotel looked very quaint. It borders on hotel and inn, leaning more towards the inn side, but it was nice. The attendants werent the most helpful in the world, but we kind of knew what we wanted to do anyway. We got an atrium room and it was nice with period-style pieces and exposed brick. It is a little on the small side, but once you get past that its comfortable. All we did was pretty much sleep there anyway. The location of this hotel is what makes it amazing. It is in one of the most active areas of Boston, with tons of restaurants, shops and pubs within walking distance. You are a block and a half from Quincy market and a block from the waterfront and acquarium. The location was by far the greatest aspect to this hotel- you could walk everywhere. Even a walk to Boston Common was a short 15-minute walk and you could do it 24 hours a day, VERY safe. We really enjoyed our stay in Boston- the shops were fun, the food was excellent and the nighlift couldnt be beat. If you're interested in a pint and some good music, go to the Black Rose, 1/2 a block from the hotel. Had a blast there all night with authentic Irish music. The hotel throughout performed its duty very well, it provided a comfortable place to relax, get a second wind and sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel I've ever stayed in...EVER!”
Reviews.Author: coffeetogo
Reviews.Content: Ok, for $200. (which is not bad for Boston)we got a room evidentely mid-renovation but clean. When we checked in, my parking space that I had reserved months ahead, was not saved. Luckily, we found a closer garage that was actually cheaper. We stayed here last year in an atrium room and there was a wedding going on until late. Noisy but ended about 12:30 or so. THIS year, I thought I'd be smarter and reserve a City view room. OH MY GOD! The bar below,(4 floors below) sounded like it was in the room with us! The hotel is quite old, like much of Boston, and the windows are thin but this was unbelievable. We slept from about 3:30am to 6:30 am and took off. The person at the desk was mildly apologetic and gave me the card of the manager. It took me 2 days to get through to the manager and he did nothing for me monetarily. He offered a credit to stay at the sister hotel (which I have done before and it also was noisy). I understand that the hotel can not do much about another establishment but I feel it IS their duty to let the patron know that the room they will be sleeping in is subject to a restless night. Actually, they should not even rent these rooms out on the weekend. The location is great so it is unfortunate that I will pay more to stay somewhere else next year but I was livid and think the management should be above board with their guests about the noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Do not do it!! ”
Reviews.Author: runewarun
Reviews.Content: We just returned from that hotel and it was HELL. Our room â€“ although clean â€“ was extremely loud. We arranged to stay at that hotel because our friends from Europe booked themselves a room at that place and since we wanted to visit with them we decided to stay at the same place. We got to our room about 8 pm and thought the windows were open because it was so noisy! A construction crew was working outside our window drilling with pneumatic jackhammers and digging with a forklift truck. They finally finished up around 12:30 am, only to our dismay to return at 1:30 to resume working. They continued to work until 3:20 am! At 6 am another crew started work there as well. We got two hours of sleep. Repeated calls to the local police and complaints with the hotelâ€™s front desk went nowhere, although the staff was aware of the noise situation and told us that others had complained the night before and that they themselves called 911 the previous night to complain about it. The front desk did offer us the only other available room, but it was a smoking room and it really stank! Due to no sleep, we canceled the rest of our planned stay in Boston and decided to return home on the next available flight. Upon check-out the manager had apparently just left, but we insisted that the front desk contact him and they were finally able to reach him on his mobile phone. He claimed to be â€œsorryâ€� for what had happened but was not willing to take any responsibility for this miserable experience because it was not in his "control," and he declined to compensate us even part of the room rate. We will follow-up with the owner as well as file a complaint with Better Business Bureau. Apparently, the crews are working on the "Big Dig" project in Boston, which has been ongoing for several years now, and they had been working at this particular location for three days, which the hotel staff was well aware of â€“ even at the time we made the reservation. At a minimum, we believe the hotel was responsible for informing its guests upon making reservations that although it had rooms available, they are next to the construction project, which would allow the guest to make an informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep deprivation experiment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing. The staff was friendly and accomodating, the room was clean but old, the decor is charming with exposed brick walls, a nice change from large chain accomodations. Now the bad news. I like to sleep. I like to sleep at night. Sleeping at night is good for you. Good sleep makes your vacation more enjoyable. If you can survive on 2 or 3 hours of sleep a night, by all means stay here. The bar next to the hotel is EXTREMELY LOUD and I even sleep with earplugs because my partner snores, it was October so our windows were closed and latched. I fell asleep at 10 pm, then was awake from midnight until 4 am with loud thumping bass disco music, yelling and hooting from inside the bar, and screaming drunk girls hanging out on the sidewalk after the bar closed. Now, it is not the Hotels fault that a loud disco and bar with drunk ho's and frat boys are within spitting distance, but they could and should install new, double paned, soundproof windows on that side of the building (might I suggest Milgard Windows from Washington State?). That might help somewhat. I won't stay here next time I go to Boston. If you really want to be close to a bar with girls gone wild and frat boys, for some reason, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: CathyC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a atrium room for one night on 6th October. We were able to check in as soon as we arrived at 1pm. We took the subway in from the airport and started to look for the road name and there was the hotel straight across the road. The room was big, and really pleasant - no natural light -but that's not a big deal. The bathroom was nice, lovely fluffy towels too. We were only a couple of minutes from Quincy Market. The only negative thing I could say was the wooden floor in the bedroom was a bit dirty. The room was quiet at night too. Would definately stay there again if in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub Noise”
Reviews.Author: snowbird_1955
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbourside Inn for 2 nights, the first night being a Saturday night. Our room was a city view and the noise level from 10pm until 4pm was unbearable. Music, screaming drunks, cars and taxi's hooting through the night. We rang reception at requested a different room and was advised that the inn was full. The lack of sleep ruined the following day for us, fortunately we were able to change rooms for our last night. We requested compensation and were told that the duty manager would deal speak with the Manager, we asked four times then gave up.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about location...and not much else”
Reviews.Author: leonc1234
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, if you want a great location for the North End, Fanueil Hall, Aquarium, this place is great. T stop is right in front, easy walk to shopping on Washington...but it has no other positive attributes. The problems we had there were minor inconveniences, but still, when you're paying about 200/night (inc. taxes), you expect more/better services. 1. They told us the day before we came that they had wireless internet access. And they did...but it only works if you sit directly in front of the front desk. Nowhere else in the lobby or hotel (certainly not in our 5th flr room). 2. Our toilet backed up a couple times. They always came and fixed it...but we didn't want to deal with this. The rooms were clean but quite small. About the size of small suite on a cruise ship...but with less useful furniture. The one ice machine is in the basement. All in all, not really a bad place...but could hardly call it a good place or even a good value. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: R08ert
Reviews.Content: Opted to stay in the Harborside following a visit throughout New England. Primary location, easy to find even in a rental car. Great location for sightseeing in Boston - Have stayed in Back Bay before, and downtown location is far better. Room was adequate for our needs and array of restaurants and bars nearby meant eating was not a problem. Main and major drawback is the noise levels. Currently the 'Big Dig' occupies much of the Bayside area and work at night means that, having opted for the more expensive townview rooms, noise levels were high. This disturbed our sleep to a great extent and I would recommend for this reason alone that either an inside room, or an alternative hotel is sought. The hotel was busy although the staff were sufficiently attentive and available.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: kp1978
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Harborside Inn for 4 nights, and have no complaints. The room was spotless, very roomy and comfortable. The bed was fabulous. The staff was friendly, and the location canÂ´t be beat. If I ever visit Boston again, this will definitely be my choice!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Harborside Inn!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw mixed reviews for this place on Tripadvisor but as my husband and I were on a tight budget on an overnight trip to Boston and this hotel seemed good value I took my chances and booked the Harborside Inn... Boy, do I regret it! We were considerably overcharged when they refused to honor the price I had confirmed over the phone a week prior to check in. The staff were uncooperative when we brought the problem to their attention. The manager was rude and dismissive when we spoke to him about it and when pressed for a solution he dumbly pointed at his computer monitor screen and with a condescending smirk he said, "No, around here this is the rate..." He finally suggested we ask for a written confirmation of our room rate next time - and with the next breath informed us that THAT is a service they do not offer! (?) On top of the awful service and all round inept staff, our room was very stuffy and claustrophobic. The lack of a real window made us feel like we were boxed in. The bed was old and creaky, like the springs were giving out and the pillows were covered in thick plastic so it seemed kind of sterile and kind of like being in a hospital. I strongly recommend that you max out your credit card if you have to, pay another $50 or $80 and have a nice stay at the Omni Parker or ANYWHERE ELSE before you take a chance on this horrible so called hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: alanannemarie
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in this hotel sept.2005 great location very helpful staff comfortable and clean rooms reasonably priced. Only thing missing was no tea/coffee facilities in the room but free in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very stuffy and neither the evening staff at the front desk nor the management were eager to help. The rooms are small and without windows to the outside. The location is convenient (across the street from the subway and 1 block from Fanueil Hall) but with the mass transit system the location doesn't come close to making up for the price of this hotel and the poor service. Next time I will stay a bit farther out from downtown and use the subway more. I won't be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Bed No Breakfast and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Name of the business is The Harborside Bed and Breakfast. When I stay at a hotel the bed is the most important item. This bed left a lot to be desired. I had to put a pillow between my wife and I so that I would stop sliding into the pit in the middle of the mattress. When I was finally able to fall asleep I was awoken by a drunk person knocking on all the doors on our floor. The sounds reverberate throughout the courtyard for an hour. The room looked charming enough when we entered, apon closer inspection, the headboard was glued together, the TV had an amazing rainbow color on all channels. Trying to watch a Red Sox Game the grass at Fenway went from a bright blue to a lemon yellow. There was such a strong smell of bleach, that we wanted them to change our room, they would not. The only plus that this Hotel has going for it is it's location, right next door to Fanieul Hall. At $200 a night it was way steep.

Reviews.Title: “Good Tourist Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in June, 2005 and found the location really great for a day's touring around Boston. The MBTA's Aquarium Station was at the door. (You can buy a bus and train pass) The Quincey Markets, where you could purchase a variety of meals, were a short stroll away. Either side of this hotel were places to have a breakfast or an evening meal and a pub drink. The hotel is a historical building with hardwood floors and an atrium courtyard. The decor is a bit spartan, but is a change from regular hotels. Front of house service by Christof was pleasant and he was helpful with directions during our stay. This hotel gave us the flavour of Boston and we could see some of the finishing touches to the "Big Dig". We would recommend this hotel for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Hardwood floors, brick walls, sleigh beds....what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: scooty
Reviews.Content: The Harborside scores huge points with me for its simple, comfortable, and cozy decor. Dark hardwood floors, brick walls, and a sleigh bed! What a wonderful break from the standard carpet and utilitarian furnishings. The hotel is a well located, right near the Aquarium, Waterfront, and Custom Tower. It's also a pretty good price for Boston, usually under $200 per night. I found the rooms clean and attractive, almost like being in an actual bedroom rather than a hotel. The service was professional but not aggressively smiley - which is fine by me. The guy giving me my key does not need to be my new best friend. I did notice a few of the furnishings are a little bit worn, and the bathroom decor is much more Holiday Inn style, failing to match the charm of the rest of the room. The hallways are non-descript, though the design of the lobby, which is open up to the top floor, is unique. There are loads of papers to read and nice leather chairs to relax on in front of the elevators. The restaurant was being remodeled. Speaking of remodeling, the Big Dig is still goin' strong, 15 years and counting! I had a room on the street side (because I wanted the view,) and could definitely hear construction noise, though it didn't bother me. In fact, it was neat to look out and watch. Now I know why it's taking so long. (I watched a shovel push the same mound of dirt back and forth for days...) I am sure when the Big Dig is over, should it ever be completed, the Harborside will raise its rates, so enjoy it now. Speaking of noise, I had read on tripadvisor that the outside rooms were noisy from the local bars. This was a Thursday, so I wasn't too worried. It ended up being fairly quiet, until about 1am. I was then treated to an extremely loud conversation - every word audible. Looking down seven stories I saw the culprits: one single pair of women smoking and chatting. I can't imagine how loud a big crowd would be. Anyhow, if it's winter or a weeknight, you should be OK, but otherwise, unless you're a heavy sleeper, you may want to sacrafice the view and take the atrium (inside, no view) room.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small but dirty and smelly (urine?) room. Had to change our sheets ourselves before being able to sleep. Great location ruined by poor quality quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best part of this inn is that it is perfectly located for a tourist in Boston. You literally are steps from the T stop. You are like two blocks from the Aquarium AND Quincy Market and tons of shopping. You can sign up to do the trolley tours in the same area. The rooms are small, but they're fine! They even have a fan in the closet, which we needed since it was 90 degrees when we visited! J There is also a 24 hour convience store right next door, so that's great too. Highly recommend to those who don't need a gym, and movies to order in the room, etc. things like that. It's got the basics and that's it. If you are busy in the city you won't miss any of it anyway. We will always stay here when in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Powerpaddy
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, reasonably priced. Restaurant / Bar was closed for refurb but it didnt matter because there were so many bars and restaurants nearby. Rooms were smallish but overall, very convenient for everything and good value for money. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a cruise from Montreal to Boston, we spent 3 days at the Harborside Inn. Location was great, close to everything. Rooms are small but comfortable and tastefully decorated. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend to others and would stay there again if our travels take us to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, cute!”
Reviews.Author: TeddyBear03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harborside this past week and were very happy with our choice. We have stayed at Club Quarters and the Ritz-Carlton Boston Common as well, and although we ADORE the Ritz, of the three, this one was the best bargain. The Harborside is in a wonderful location, to start with. The T stop (blue line) is right outside the main entrance and fun, touristy Quincy Market is a quick walk around the block. Our room was a nice size, and I loved how different it looks from chain hotels. There are beautiful hard wood floors and two of the walls are brick with ceiling to floor windows and high ceilings. Very tastefully decorated. It can be a bit noisy in the early mornings when construction begins on 93, but it's bearable. Staff was helpful and friendly, and the price was downright cheap! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbourside Inn for the first three days of our honeymoon and thought that the hotel was in a great location next to Quincy Market, the Aquarium and right on the doorstep if you want to walk the Freedom Trail. We booked a city view room as I had read that the atrium view rooms could be quite dark inside , we found the city view room to be a bit noisy, the traffic was ok as it is now all underground but when the pubs/clubs close you do get a lot of noise from people on the street and also from the men collecting the rubbish/empty bottles very early in the morning. Although we did have a good view of the city I would recommend that you book an atrium view room as when we passed one it looked nice and not that dark inside, however these rooms are overlooked by people waiting for the lift but we would not have minded this as long as the room was quite. The restaurant was closed for some reason for breakfast, lunch and dinner we never found out why there was no reason given. We did get breakfast at Quincy Market (great choice of places to eat). The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. We would stay at the Harbourside again but next time book an atrium view room. If you are travelling from the airport by taxi make sure to let the driver know its the Harbourside Inn on State Street as there are two Harbourside Inns in the city, our taxi driver did not have a clue where he was going and had never heard of this hotel before but he did find it in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint . . yet in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: ballhatguy
Reviews.Content: Not exactly sure what to expect, we were surprised to find a charming hotel, in the absolute heart of the city, and for a very reasonable rate. Having an atrium room (small, but quaint and clean) we did not experience any noise issues and like another reviewer said, the highway is no issue at all anymore. And the entire city is literally right outside the door with Quincy Market across the street and Long Wharf just across Atlantic Ave. The Aquarium "T" stop (Blue Line) is yards away and made getting to the airport (and everywhere for that matter) easy and cheap (Take the subway! It is $1.25, two stops, and a free shuttle to your gate.) While we had a slight "plumbing problem", who cares. It could happen anywhere and it was a quick call to the desk. The atrium room made it even more affordable and we would definately stay at the Harborside again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Convenient”
Reviews.Author: CCosolo
Reviews.Content: Try finding a cute, small hotel while you're on a budget, that's close to attractions and has easy access to major roads in a state of confusing construction, and NOT for weekend guests who plan on sleeping before the local music shuts down, in the middle of Boston. I found this charming European-style hotel for a great price, and since I planned on staying out late, this was a very wonderful place to be. The staff were the most pleasant people I have ever spent time with anywhere! I made a last minute change to my reservation a week before my arrival and it was no problem. I asked for another change for my roommate on the first day and again, the staff was so eager to please and friendly. The charming room was on the fifth floor overlooking the atrium, near the elevator, but I slept like a baby with the fan humming away. The bed was cozy and warm, while the spacious bathroom was one of the safest and cleanest I have seen in along time with handrails and seating for the mature individual. The cab fare between the airport was very reasonable and access to the T was available a few yards away. I walked to Quincy Market for exotic meals that cost me a few dollars. I would return to this hotel in a heartbeat, but only if I planned on staying out late on the weekend, (Fri. Sat.). Weeknights are very quiet. Great winter hotel near the harbor, too!

HotelInfo.Name: Harborside Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 185 State St., Boston, MA 02109
